column2: An associate of J.S. Mill, Alexander Bain added connections from physiology to associationist psychology, adding the laws of compound and constructive association to those of contiguity, similarity, and frequency. He was known for writing two of the earliest textbooks in psychology in 1855 and 1859, which were used by later experimental psychologists such as William James. His Spencer-Bain principle concerning probability of behavior recalls the later Behaviorist school in its conclusions.
column3: An associate of J.S. Mill, Alexander Bain added connections from physiology to associationist psychology, adding the laws of compound and constructive association to those of contiguity, similarity, and frequency. He was known for writing two of the earliest textbooks in psychology in 1855 and 1859, which were used by later experimental psychologists such as William James. His Spencer-Bain principle concerning probability of behavior recalls the later Behaviorist school in its conclusions.

column2: Alfred Adler was an Austrian doctor and psychtherapist. Adler diverged from Freud in arguing that unconscious motivation could be better explained by teleological goals rather than instinctual drives. According to Adler, people are born with a feeling of Inferiority. People attempt to overcome these feelings of inferiority. Adler posited one of three outcomes. An 'inferiority complex' develops in people who are overwhelmed by these feelings. Some of these will develop a superiority complex to mask their true feelings. Psychologically healthy people manifest the concept of self-esteem and satsify their goals through a sense of personal achievement.
column3: Alfred Adler was an Austrian doctor and psychtherapist. Adler diverged from Freud in arguing that unconscious motivation could be better explained by teleological goals rather than instinctual drives. According to Adler, people are born with a feeling of Inferiority. People attempt to overcome these feelings of inferiority. Adler posited one of three outcomes. An 'inferiority complex' develops in people who are overwhelmed by these feelings. Some of these will develop a superiority complex to mask their true feelings. Psychologically healthy people manifest the concept of self-esteem and satsify their goals through a sense of personal achievement.

column2: Alfred Binet was a French psychologist who pioneered the use of standardized testing to measure individual differences in intelligence. The French government commissioned Binet and his student Theodore Simon to develop a test in 1899 to differentiate 'retarded' from 'normal' children. The Simon-Binet test divided intelligence into several areas and measured each with a battery of questions. Questions considered to measure higher ability were those answered more often by students whom their teachers had rated highly. Binet also believed that intelligences were inherited, but improvable by education. His test assigned a single 'mental-level' score to each subject based on their test results.
column3: Alfred Binet was a French psychologist who pioneered the use of standardized testing to measure individual differences in intelligence. The French government commissioned Binet and his student Theodore Simon to develop a test in 1899 to differentiate 'retarded' from 'normal' children. The Simon-Binet test divided intelligence into several areas and measured each with a battery of questions. Questions considered to measure higher ability were those answered more often by students whom their teachers had rated highly. Binet also believed that intelligences were inherited, but improvable by education. His test assigned a single 'mental-level' score to each subject based on their test results.

column2: He was, first and foremost, a brilliant and original theorist.
column3: Il fut avant tout un théoricien brillant et original.

column2: Alfred Bernhard Nobel was a Swedish chemist, engineer, innovator, and armaments manufacturer. He is the inventor of dynamite, and in his last will he used his enormous fortune to institute the Nobel Prizes.
column3: Alfred Bernhard Nobel was a Swedish chemist, engineer, innovator, and armaments manufacturer. He is the inventor of dynamite, and in his last will he used his enormous fortune to institute the Nobel Prizes.

column2: Alite is a name for tricalcium silicate. It is the major, and characteristic, mineral phases in Portland cement.
column3: Alite is a name for tricalcium silicate. It is the major, and characteristic, mineral phases in Portland cement.

column2: In alternating current or AC systems electrons flow in both directions in wave patterns. After a fierce competition with direct current, alternating current got dominance for most domestic and industrial applications. One of the first applications were the electric chairs, which didn't help in convincing that alternating current wasn't more dangerous than direct current.
column3: En courant alternatif ou AC, les électrons circulent dans les deux directions sous forme d'ondes. Après une compétition féroce avec le courant continu, le courant alternatif obtint la domination pour la plupart des applications domestiques et industrielles. L'une de ses premières applications fut la chaise électrique, ce qui n'aida pas pour convaincre que l'alternatif n'était pas plus dangereux que le continu.

column2: By letting the staff produce several alternative plans, the best alternative could be discerned faster by the commander. Also if things changed, the commander and his staff always had an alternative to go for quickly.
column3: En laissant l'état-major produire plusieurs plans alternatifs, la meilleure solution peut-être discerner plus rapidement par le commandant en chef. Ainsi, si les choses ont changé, le commandement a toujours une alternative à proposer en situation d'urgence.
Calcul des zones d'effet des munitions

column2: By making statistical standard measurements of how much ammunition was needed to give the right effect against a predefined size of enemy unit in a predefined square area, combat became more cost efficient.
column3: En établissant des mesures statistiques standard sur le nombre de munitions nécessaire pour produire l'effet voulu sur un dispositif ennemi de taille donnée dans un espace de combat donné, on a pu baisser le coût des opérations militaires.

column2: This was the combination of premeasured firing speed and area hit differentiators. It enabled the gun to fire optimized to get the best hit picture at the lowest ammunition usage rates.
column3: En combinant les mesures de cadence de tir et les différentiels de zones d'impact, on a pu optimiser les tirs et améliorer le rapport efficacité/dépense en munitions.

column2: Here, a wide variety of ammunitions are produced. The prerequisites are iron, coal and sulphur.
column3: C'est ici que sont produits différents types de munitions à partir de fer, de charbon et de soufre.

column2: The design and production of basic munitions saw much improvement over the course of the 19th century. Advances in weapons design -- from muzzle to breech loads to semi-automatics and machine guns -- naturally meant that the design and production of ammunition also had to follow suit.
column3: La conception et la production de munitions de base ont connu une nette amélioration au cours du XIXe siècle. Les progrès de l'armement (des fusils chargés par le canon aux fusils chargés par la culasse, en passant par les armes semi-automatiques et les mitrailleuses) ont naturellement entraîné une amélioration de la conception et de la production de munitions.

column2: The experiences of the First World War had demonstrated not only the potential of large-scale amphibious warfare, but also the limitations of current practices and equipment. As such, in the interwar period the major powers worked to increase their capability to launch effective amphibious assaults. These efforts included not only the development of needed equipment, such as purpose-built landing craft, but also the creation and training of land units specializing in amphibious assaults, and the creation of specific naval strategies and tactics to best utilize warships in support and defence of amphibious operations.
column3: Les expériences de la Première Guerre mondiale avaient démontré non seulement le potentiel de la guerre amphibie de grande ampleur, mais aussi les limites des pratiques actuelles et de l'équipement. Ainsi, dans l'entre deux guerres les grandes puissances ont travaillé à accroître leur capacité à lancer des assauts amphibies efficaces. Ces efforts comprennent non seulement le développement des équipements nécessaires, tels que les péniches de débarquement construites à cet effet, mais aussi la création et la formation d'unités de terrain spécialisées en assaut amphibie, et la création de stratégies navales spécifiques et de plus, des tactiques pour utiliser au mieux les navires de guerre en appui et en défense des ces opérations amphibies.

column2: In 1861 King Rama IV, also known as King Mongkut, the fourth Siamese monarch of the house of Chakri, expressed in a letter to president James Buchanan of the United States, upon having heard from an American captain visiting Siam that there were no elephants in America, his desire to gift one to the United States. By offering to send an Elephant to the Americans, our relations will surely improve!
column3: En 1861, le roi Rama IV, également connu sous le titre de roi Mongkut, quatrième monarque de la maison de Chakri, exprima en ces termes dans une lettre adressée au président des États-Unis James Buchanan, après avoir appris de la bouche d'un capitaine américain en visite au Royaume du Siam qu'il n'y avait pas d'éléphants en Amérique, son désir d'en offrir un aux États-Unis. En proposant d'offrir un éléphant aux Américains, nos relations ne pourront que s'améliorer !

column2: The development of anaesthesia will allows patients to undergo surgery without the distress and pain they would otherwise experience. It is an incredible advancement in medical technology.
column3: The development of anaesthesia will allows patients to undergo surgery without the distress and pain they would otherwise experience. It is an incredible advancement in medical technology.

column2: With mutual enemies among the Great Powers, perhaps it is best if the British Empire and our nation work together.
column3: With mutual enemies among the Great Powers, perhaps it is best if the British Empire and our nation work together.

column2: The daughter of Sigmund Freud, Anna began her psychoanalytic practice in 1923. She served as secretary of the International Psychoanalytical Association between 1925 and 1934. Freud became known for her work on the social importance of the ego in childhood development. She wrote 'Ego and the Mechanisms of Defense' (1936) in which she further developed the concept of defense mechanisms such as repression, displacement, reaction formation and rationalization. These are mental processes to reduce consciousness of wishes, memories and thoughts that prove threatening to self-esteem and security of the individual.
column3: The daughter of Sigmund Freud, Anna began her psychoanalytic practice in 1923. She served as secretary of the International Psychoanalytical Association between 1925 and 1934. Freud became known for her work on the social importance of the ego in childhood development. She wrote 'Ego and the Mechanisms of Defense' (1936) in which she further developed the concept of defense mechanisms such as repression, displacement, reaction formation and rationalization. These are mental processes to reduce consciousness of wishes, memories and thoughts that prove threatening to self-esteem and security of the individual.

column2: Abdullahi dan Fodio (1766-1828), the emir of Gwandu, wrote, while he was still alive, a book on the Fulani Jihad, the baptism of fire by which Sokoto was formed. By spreading word of this magnificent work of history, we can bring glory and renown to our nation.
column3: Le regretté Abdullahi dan Fodio (1766-1828), émir de Gwandou, a écrit un livre sur le djihad Peul, le baptême de feu par lequel Sokoto fut formé. En vantant partout ce magnifique ouvrage d'histoire, nous pourrons apporter gloire et renommée à notre nation.

column2: The native population of Easter Island has suffered many devastations in recent years, from attacks by Peruvian pirates to a tuberculosis epidemic. A colonist has operated a sheep ranch there for some years, and recently offered to sell to our government. Considering his ranch covers a large portion of the island, we would be well within our rights to claim sovereignty over it.

column2: The Newlands Resolution was a joint resolution of The U.S. Congress passed in 1898, and named after congressman Francis G. Newlands, which annexed the Republic of Hawaii to the United States, thus creating the Territory of Hawaii.

column3: The Kingdom of Lan Na must unite with Siam, for the benefit of both our nations in resisting imperialist control.

column2: International pressure has been mounting over the issue of The Congo Free State. The Free State, which is governed as the personal property of our Monarch, is receiving a barrage of international criticism on account of the brutal colonial policies enforced there. Our best option at this stage is probably to annex the Free State and reform its administration.
column3: La pression internationale monte au sujet de lEtat Libre du Congo. LÉtat Libre, qui est gouverné comme une propriété privée de notre souverain reçoit une volée de bois vert de la part de la communauté internationale au sujet du comportement brutal des colons. Notre meilleure option est sans doute dannexer lEtat Libre et den réformer ladministration.

column2: This view is based on the theory of natural justice, which says that how people are born can never be unjust. Justice is completely relational. The effect is that the view that actions must be made to increase equality is wrong, if such action is not correcting a legal error.
column3: Cette opinion est basée sur la théorie de la justice naturelle, qui dit que la façon dont les gens sont nés ne peut jamais être injuste. La justice est entièrement relationnelle. L'effet est que le point de vue que les actions doivent être faites pour accroître l'égalité est fausse, si une telle action n'est pas la correction d'une erreur de droit.

column2: This meant that to become an officer it was no longer enough to be of gentle blood. You also had to attend a formal education which could at best be as good as any college. This was one of the most important causes behind the professionalization of the officers corps.

column2: By letting the staff produce several alternative plans, the best alternative could be discerned faster by the commander. Also if things changed, the commander and his staff always had an alternative to go for quickly.
column3: En laissant l'état-major produire plusieurs plans alternatifs, la meilleure solution peut-être discerner plus rapidement par le commandant en chef. Ainsi, si les choses ont changé, le commandement a toujours une alternative à proposer en situation d'urgence.

column2: By using a staff system even at low echelon units, leaders were enabled to give orders continuously and accurately.
column3: Grâce à l'existence d'états-majors mêmes aux échelons inférieurs, le commandant en chef pouvait donner en permanence des ordres précis.

column2: This meant that an officer could temporary delegate authority to one or more of his subordinates when it came to clearly defined areas of responsibilities. This meant that he did not have to control everything himself at all times and that he could focus on the important questions.

column2: The old rules said that an officer breaking an order of a higher officer was to be brought to court martial. This made decision-making very indecisive. column3: Les anciennes règles précisent qu'un officier enfreignant les ordres d'un officier supérieur devait passer en cour martiale. Cela rend la prise de décision très floue. À ce stade, les réglements disent que les actes d'un officier doivent être jugés par rapport à l'idée de base du commandement de son supérieur, mais la façon dont cela est fait relève de sa propre discrétion.

column2: These are the education and leadership principles used by your officer corps. Better leadership procedures will increase the organization and morale values of your units.

column2: In a highly militarized society, or a normal society in war, often not only military-civilian cooperation boards on a local level were needed, but sometimes most of the local government could be appointed officers as well. column3: Dans une société fortement militarisée, ou une société normale en guerre, il est souvent nécessaire, non seulement d'avoir la coopération civilo-militaire au niveau local, mais parfois d'avoir dans l'administration locale des officiers en poste. Cela signifie non seulement un fort contrôle militaire, mais aussi que la puissance de l'Armée peut augmenter de manière disproportionnée par rapport à d'autres agences gouvernementales.

column2: In wartime an influential Army that had lobbied for their cause for a long time could get full control not only over the execution of the war, but also over the resource management of the country. This could basically be called a Military Dictatorship governed by the General Staff.

column2: Article 9 of the Japanese Constitution is a clause in the National Constitution of Japan which states that "the Japanese people forever renounce war as a sovereign right of the nation and the threat or use of force as a means of settling international disputes " and that "land, sea, and air forces, as well as other war potential, will never be maintained." As long as the Japanese Government maintains Article 9 as an official stance, it will have trouble maintaining a standing army without being scrutinized by pacifists at home and abroad.
column3: Article 9 of the Japanese Constitution is a clause in the National Constitution of Japan which states that "the Japanese people forever renounce war as a sovereign right of the nation and the threat or use of force as a means of settling international disputes " and that "land, sea, and air forces, as well as other war potential, will never be maintained." As long as the Japanese Government maintains Article 9 as an official stance, it will have trouble maintaining a standing army without being scrutinized by pacifists at home and abroad.

column2: Article 9 of the National Constitution of Japan states that "the Japanese people forever renounce war as a sovereign right of the nation and the threat or use of force as a means of settling international disputes " and that "land, sea, and air forces, as well as other war potential, will never be maintained." Ratifying Article 9 will cut military spending significantly and push the Government of Japan to demilitarize in favor of a peaceful coexistence with China, Korea, and its Western allies.

column2: French philosopher, mathematician and economist, Augustin Cournot has been rightly hailed as one of the greatest of the Proto-Marginalists.  The unique insights of his major economics work, Researches into the Mathematical Principles of Wealth (1838) were without parallel.  Although neglected in his time, the impact of Cournot work on modern economics can hardly be overstated.
column3: Le philosophe français, mathématicien et économiste, Augustin Cournot a été à juste titre salué comme l'un des plus grands des proto-marginalistes. Les idées uniques de son uvre majeure économique, Recherches sur les principes mathématiques de la richesse (1838) ont été sans équivalents. Bien que négligé de son temps, l'impact du travail de Cournot sur l'économie moderne ne peut guère être exagéré.

column2: With the great empire of the Habsburgs now lost to us, perhaps it is time to look north towards the unification of Germany. First, however, we must bring the South German Confederation under our own leadership.
column3: With the great empire of the Habsburgs now lost to us, perhaps it is time to look north towards the unification of Germany. First, however, we must bring the South German Confederation under our own leadership.

column2: While Germany was not united until the proclamation of the German Empire, following the Franco-Prussian war, rising nationalism in the 19th century had meant that unification had been on the cards long before that, with the Frankfurt assembly of 1848 being an important forerunner. By achieving a dominant position among the South German states, we can form the South German Confederation.
column3: Il fallut attendre la proclamation de l'Empire allemand qui suivit la guerre franco-allemande pour assister à l'unification de l'Allemagne. Pourtant, avec la montée du nationalisme au XIXe siècle, l'unification aurait été possible bien avant cela, comme en témoigne l'assemblée de Francfort de 1848. Dans les années 1860, la Prusse et l'Autriche, qui se disputaient la position dominante au sein d'une grande Allemagne, formèrent chacune leur propre confédération d'États allemands : les États du sud de l'Allemagne et la Confédération de l'Allemagne du nord. En nous imposant dans les États du sud, nous formerons les États du sud de l'Allemagne.

column2: While Germany was not united until the proclamation of the German Empire, following the Franco-Prussian war, rising nationalism in the 19th century had meant that unification had been on the cards long before that, with the Frankfurt assembly of 1848 being an important forerunner. By achieving a dominant position among the South German states, we can form the South German Confederation.
column3: Il fallut attendre la proclamation de l'Empire allemand qui suivit la guerre franco-allemande pour assister à l'unification de l'Allemagne. column2: Derived from the Ancient Greek for self-sufficiency, in the early twentieth century autarky was the goal for many States that felt further dependence upon the global economy was a threat to their national independence or the ideological basis of their regimes. In order to achieve autarky, such states would impose huge tariff barriers to imports from overseas, encourage the development of local industries to produce goods previously imported, strictly regulate foreign trade to preserve national income, and investigate the development of alternative substitutes to critical raw materials that were not available to the nation except from the world market. As an economic policy autarky could be called a twentieth-century revision of mercantilism, and while most often used by Communist and Fascist regimes that rejected all or part the capitalist model of economic production, even capitalist nations would resort to elements of autarky in times of economic instability, especially if they controlled large overseas empires that could provide key raw materials.
column3: Dérivé du grec ancien pour l'autosuffisance, dans le début du XXe siècle l'autarcie était l'objectif pour de nombreux États qui se sentaient bien trop liés avec l'économie mondiale qui était une menace pour leur indépendance nationale ou la base idéologique de leur régime. Afin d'atteindre l'autarcie, ces Etats imposaient des barrières tarifaires aux importations en provenance de l'étranger, encouragaient le développement des industries locales à produire des marchandises précédemment importées, réglementaient strictement le commerce extérieur pour préserver le revenu national, et encourageaient le développement de substituts alternatifs aux matières premières critiques qui n'étaient pas disponibles à la nation, excepté sur le marché mondial. Comme l'autarcie politique économique pouvait être vue comme une révision du XXe siècle du mercantilisme, et alors que souvent approprié par les communistes et les régimes fascistes qui rejetent tout ou partie du modèle capitaliste de la production économique, même les nations capitalistes auraient recours à des éléments de l'autarcie en temps d'instabilité économique, surtout si elles contrôlaient de grands empires d'outre-mer qui pouvaient fournir les principales matières brutes.

column2: Authoritarianism is the view that authority is the most important value which gives balance and stability to it. It is often combined with traditionalism to give an epistemological foundation for who should wield this authority.
column3: L'autoritarisme est la conception selon laquelle l'autorité est la valeur essentielle pour l'équilibre et la stabilité sociale. Il se mêle souvent de traditionalisme pour donner un fondement épistémologique à celui qui doit brandir cette autorité.

column2: They were outnumbered forty to one in some sections of the front, and still held the line' a high military commander praised the bravery of our soldiers, who managed to delay enemy advance in $STRING_0_3$ for as long as it was strategically feasible, and inflicted $VALUE_INT_0_2$ of casualties against our foes. 'We are not ready to publish the number of casualties on our side' a government official replied, when asked about our own losses. 'Our people must rally behind the government when it comes to national defence' he challenged the sceptics.
column3: Ils étaient moins nombreux jusqu'à 40 contre 1 dans certaines sections du front, et ont toujours tenu la ligne. 'Un commandant militaire de haut rang a salué la bravoure de nos soldats, qui ont réussi à retarder l'avance ennemie en $STRING_0_3$ aussi longtemps qu'il était possible, et ont infligés $VALUE_INT_0_2$ de pertes contre nos ennemis. 'Nous ne sommes pas prêts à publier le nombre de victimes de notre côté' a répondu un fonctionnaire du gouvernement, lorsqu'on l'a interrogé sur nos propres pertes. 'Notre peuple doit se rallier derrière le gouvernement quand il s'agit de la défense nationale', il a défié les sceptiques.

column2: Our brave soldiers succeeded in slowing down enemy advance against our territory, fighting a pitched battle against outnumbering force from $TAG_0_2$. 'If we lose every battle in such a great fashion, we might as well win this entire war' a high ranking officer commented.
column3: Nos braves soldats ont réussi à ralentir l'avance de l'ennemi sur notre territoire, une bataille rangée contre des forces numériquement supérieures de $TAG_0_2$. 'Si nous perdons chaque bataille avec une telle manière, nous pourrions tout aussi bien gagner cette guerre', a commenté un officier de haut rang.

column2: On $DATE_LONG_0$ we successfully evacuated troops from the battle of $STRING_0_3$, inflicting $VALUE_INT_0_2$ casualties, but leaving $TAG_0_2$ in control of the field.
column3: Le $DATE_LONG_0$, nous avons évacué avec succès les troupes de la bataille de $STRING_0_3$, infligeant $VALUE_INT_0_2$ victimes, mais en laissant à $TAG_0_2$ le contrôle de la zone.

column2: On $DATE_LONG_0$ our incompetent high command shockingly sent $VALUE_INT_0_4$ of our brave soldiers to their deaths in $STRING_0_3$ against the forces of  $TAG_0_2$. Our $VALUE_INT_0_3$ fine troops faced $VALUE_INT1$ $TAG_0_2_ADJ$ soldiers, and despite poor leadership and the enemy's underhanded tactics managed to inflict $VALUE_INT_0_2$ casualties upon them. This paper expresses grave concerns over the direction the high command is taking this war, and strongly urges the Government to take steps to correct it before it is too late!
column3: Le $DATE_LONG_0$ notre état-major incompétent a scandaleusement envoyé à la mort $VALUE_INT_0_4$ de nos braves soldats en $STRING_0_3$ contre des troupes de $TAG_0_2$. Nos $VALUE_INT_0_3$ beaux soldats ont fait face à $VALUE_INT1$ soldats $TAG_0_2_ADJ$. En dépit d'une absence de véritables chefs, la tactique sournoise de l'ennemi a réussi à nous infliger $VALUE_INT_0_2$ pertes. Nous exprimons notre profonde préocupation quant à la gestion de cette guerre par le haut commandement de notre armée et exhortons le gouvernement à prendre les décisions qui s'imposent avant qu'il ne soit trop tard !

column2: Reports from the field tell us that on $DATE_LONG_0$, our courageous troops have made a tactical retreat from the battle against $TAG_0_3$ in $STRING_0_3$. This has been proven necessary to maximise our element of unpredictability and surprise. $VALUE_INT_0_4$ enemy soldiers have been killed by our valiant boys. Although $VALUE_INT_0_2$ of our soldiers are yet to report back for duty, it's worth noting that many of our troops remain hidden to surprise the enemy in an ambush, showing true courage and resilience!
column3: Les rapports sur le terrain nous disent que le $DATE_LONG_0$, nos troupes courageuses ont fait une retraite tactique dans la lutte contre $TAG_0_3$ en $STRING_0_3$. Cela s'est avéré nécessaire pour favoriser notre élément d'imprévisibilité et la surprise. $VALUE_INT_0_4$ soldats ennemis ont été tués par nos vaillants garçons. Bien que $VALUE_INT_0_2$ de nos soldats soient toujours portés disparus, il est intéressant de noter que beaucoup de nos troupes restent cachées pour surprendre l'ennemi lors d'embuscade, montrant le vrai courage et la résilience!

column2: On $DATE_LONG_0$ we lost the battle of $STRING_0_3$, losing $VALUE_INT_0_4$ men and leaving $TAG_0_2$ in control of the field.

column2: On $DATE_LONG_0$ our unrivalled army was, once again, victorious in the battle of $STRING_0_3$! $VALUE_INT_0_1$ of our men bravely gave $VALUE_INT_0_3$ $TAG_0_3_ADJ$ troops a sound seeing to, and while $VALUE_INT_0_2$ of our fearless troops lost their lives, over $VALUE_INT_0_4$ $TAG_0_3_ADJ$ scoundrels were killed and the field was left in our hands. After a defeat like this, $TAG_0_3$ surely must soon seek peace terms!
column3: Le $DATE_LONG_0$ notre armée sans égal a été, une fois de plus, victorieuse à la bataille de $STRING_0_3$! $VALUE_INT_0_1$ nos hommes braves donnèrent une leçon à $VALUE_INT_0_3$ $TAG_0_3_ADJ$ , et bien que $VALUE_INT_0_2$ de nos intrépides soldats perdirent leur vie, plus de $VALUE_INT_0_4$ de ces méprisables $TAG_0_3_ADJ$ furent tués, nous laissant le champ libre. Après une telle défaite, $TAG_0_3$ va certainement demander la paix.

column2: On $DATE_LONG_0$ we defeated $VALUE_INT_0_3$ $TAG_0_3_ADJ$ troops in $STRING_0_3$, at the cost of $VALUE_INT_0_2$ lives lost.

column2: Even as the first Dreadnoughts were being constructed, significant interest was shown in a warship that could combine the main armament of a Dreadnought with the speed of Cruisers. Thus was born the battlecruiser, a powerful warship able to scout ahead of the main fleet and strong enough to sink any warship other than a battleship, though its weak armour would be a significant drawback.
column3: Alors même que les premiers Dreadnought étaient en cours de construction, un intérêt significatif a été montré pour un navire de guerre qui pourrait combiner l'armement principal d'un cuirassé Dreadnought avec la vitesse de croisière. Ainsi est né le croiseur de bataille, un navire de guerre puissant capable de jouer le rôle d'éclaireur pour la flotte principale et assez fort pour couler un navire de guerre autre qu'un navire lourd, car sa faible armure restait un inconvénient important.
Doctrine de destruction du champ de bataille

column2: Battlefield destruction called for airpower to focus on the bombing of frontline enemy military units, in close co-operation with friendly assaults launched against those enemy units.

column2: The 'Zemene Mesafint', the 'Age of Princes', was a period in Ethiopian history lasting from about 1769 to the coronation of Tweodros II in 1855, during which Ethiopia was largely fractioned due to political infighting, and the imperial office reduced to the status of a mere figurehead. The coronation of Tweodros to 'Negusa Nagast', 'King of Kings', ended the Age of Princes, and ushered in the modern Imperial era in Ethiopia. Is it time for a coronation?
column3: Zemene Mesafent, ou "Ère des Princes", désigne une période de l'histoire de l'Éthiopie, comprise entre 1769 et le couronnement de Téwodros II, en 1855, au cours de laquelle l'Éthiopie se retrouva morcelée pour cause de querelles politiques intestines, l'empire faisant alors office de simple figure de proue. Le couronnement de Téwodros comme "Negusä nägäst" (Rois des Rois) mit un terme à l'Ère des Princes éthiopienne et précéda l'ère impériale moderne. Est-ce le bon moment pour un couronnement ?

column2: A beverage or drink is a form of liquid which has been prepared for human consumption. This can include a number of different steps, some prior to transport, others immediately prior to consumption. Water is the chief constituent in all drinks, and the primary ingredient in most. Water is purified prior to drinking. Making of beverages includes, Pasteurisation, Juicing, Infusion, Percolation and Carbonation. Fermentation is a metabolic process that converts sugar to alcohol. Fermentation has been used by humans for the production of beverages since the Neolithic age.Tobacco products can generally be divided into two types: smoked tobacco (see tobacco smoking ) and smokeless tobacco. An expert in tobacco and tobacco products  especially pipes, pipe tobacco, and cigarsincluding their procurement and sale, is called a tobacconist.
column3: A beverage or drink is a form of liquid which has been prepared for human consumption. This can include a number of different steps, some prior to transport, others immediately prior to consumption. Water is the chief constituent in all drinks, and the primary ingredient in most. Water is purified prior to drinking. Making of beverages includes, Pasteurisation, Juicing, Infusion, Percolation and Carbonation. Fermentation is a metabolic process that converts sugar to alcohol. Fermentation has been used by humans for the production of beverages since the Neolithic age.Tobacco products can generally be divided into two types: smoked tobacco (see tobacco smoking ) and smokeless tobacco. An expert in tobacco and tobacco products  especially pipes, pipe tobacco, and cigarsincluding their procurement and sale, is called a tobacconist.

column2: Beer is an alcoholic beverage produced by the saccharification of starch and fermentation of the resulting sugar. The starch and saccharification enzymes are often derived from malted cereal grains, most commonly malted barley and malted wheat. Most beer is also flavoured with hops, which add bitterness and act as a natural preservative, though other flavourings such as herbs or fruit may occasionally be included. The brewing process causes a natural carbonation effect, although forced carbonation is also used. The preparation of beer is called brewing.
column3: Beer is an alcoholic beverage produced by the saccharification of starch and fermentation of the resulting sugar. The starch and saccharification enzymes are often derived from malted cereal grains, most commonly malted barley and malted wheat. Most beer is also flavoured with hops, which add bitterness and act as a natural preservative, though other flavourings such as herbs or fruit may occasionally be included. The brewing process causes a natural carbonation effect, although forced carbonation is also used. The preparation of beer is called brewing.

column2: A soft drink is a beverage that typically contains carbonated water, a sweetener and a natural or artificial flavoring. The sweetener may be sugar, high-fructose corn syrup, fruit juice, sugar substitutes (in the case of diet drinks) or some combination of these. Soft drinks may also contain caffeine, colorings, preservatives and other ingredients.
column3: A soft drink is a beverage that typically contains carbonated water, a sweetener and a natural or artificial flavoring. The sweetener may be sugar, high-fructose corn syrup, fruit juice, sugar substitutes (in the case of diet drinks) or some combination of these. Soft drinks may also contain caffeine, colorings, preservatives and other ingredients.

column2: Multiculturalism means the acceptation that many cultures may cohabit equally inside a political entity. However, some cultures are more equal than others. While members of some cultures may be welcome with open arms, others are, on the other hand, either considered 'persona non grata', expelled or even encouraged to leave the country.
column3: Le multiculturalisme signifie l'acceptation que de nombreuses cultures peuvent cohabiter à égalité à l'intérieur d'une entité politique. Cependant, certaines cultures sont plus égales que d'autres. Bien que les membres de certaines cultures peuvent être accueillis à bras ouverts, d'autres sont, d'autre part,  considérés comme "persona non grata", expulsés ou même encouragés à quitter le pays.

column2: I have been shown in the files of the War Department a statement of the Adjutant General of Massachusetts that you are the mother of five sons who have died gloriously on the field of battle. I feel how weak and fruitless must be any word of mine which should attempt to beguile you from the grief of a loss so overwhelming. But I cannot refrain from tendering you the consolation that may be found in the thanks of the Republic they died to save.' -- Abraham Lincoln\n\nBy sending a letter to Mrs. Bixby we can muster additional support for the war effort.
column3: Je viens de voir dans les dossiers du ministère de la guerre un rapport de l'Adjudant général du Massachusetts disant que vous êtes la mère de cinq fils, et que ces cinq fils sont tous morts au Champ d'Honneur. J'imagine combien serait vain et inutile le moindre mot de ma part pour essayer de vous distraire du chagrin causé par une aussi terrible perte. Mais je ne peux toutefois m'empêcher de vous rappeler la consolation que vous pourrez trouver dans la gratitude de la république pour laquelle ils sont morts. [...] -- Abraham Lincoln -- \n\nEn envoyant une lettre à Mme Bixby, nous pourrions rassembler du soutien supplémentaire pour l'effort de guerre.
La lettre de Lincoln à madame Lydia Bixby

column2: Caught between the forces of abolitionism and those supporting slavery, this state is in the throes of violence as the locals attempt to sway the entire populace one way or the other.

column2: The Block I series consisted of the concept validation satellites and reflected various stages of system development. Lessons learned from the 11 satellites in the series were incorporated into the fully operational Block II series. Dual solar arrays supplied over 400 watts of power, charging NiCd batteries for operations in Earth's shadow.
column3: The Block I series consisted of the concept validation satellites and reflected various stages of system development. Lessons learned from the 11 satellites in the series were incorporated into the fully operational Block II series. Dual solar arrays supplied over 400 watts of power, charging NiCd batteries for operations in Earth's shadow.

column2: Block II spacecraft were 3-axis stabilized, with ground pointing using reaction wheels. Two solar arrays supplied 710 watts of power, while S-band communications were used for control and telemetry. A UHF channel was use for cross-links between spacecraft. A hydrazine propulsion system was used for orbital correction. The payload included two L-band navigation signals at 1575.42 MHz (L1) and 1227.60 MHz (L2). Each spacecraft carried 2 rubidium and 2 cesium clocks, as well as nuclear detonation detection sensors, leading to a mass of 1,660 kilograms (3,660 lb).
column3: Block II spacecraft were 3-axis stabilized, with ground pointing using reaction wheels. Two solar arrays supplied 710 watts of power, while S-band communications were used for control and telemetry. A UHF channel was use for cross-links between spacecraft. A hydrazine propulsion system was used for orbital correction. The payload included two L-band navigation signals at 1575.42 MHz (L1) and 1227.60 MHz (L2). Each spacecraft carried 2 rubidium and 2 cesium clocks, as well as nuclear detonation detection sensors, leading to a mass of 1,660 kilograms (3,660 lb).

column2: Bolt action is a type of firearm action in which the weapon's bolt is operated manually by the opening and closing of the breech (barrel) with a small handle. he first bolt-action rifle was produced in 1824 by Johann Nikolaus von Dreyse, following work on breechloading rifles. European armies continued to develop bolt-action rifles through the latter half of the Nineteenth Century and World War I marked the height of the bolt-action rifle's use, with all of the nations in that war fielding troops armed with various bolt-action designs.
column3: Le fusil à culasse mobile est un type d'arme à feu dans laquelle le verrou de l'arme est actionné manuellement par l'ouverture et la fermeture de la culasse avec une petite poignée. La première carabine à verrou a été produite en 1824 par Johann Nikolaus von Dreyse, suite à des travaux sur le chargement par la culasse des fusils. Les armées européennes ont continué à développer des fusils à verrou à travers la seconde moitié du XIXe siècle et la Première Guerre mondiale marqua l'apogée de l'utilisation du fusil à verrou, avec toutes les nations qui ont équipés leur troupes avec divers fusils à culasse mobile.

column3: Ces canons tiraient à 45 degrés des bombes destinées à pénétrer le pont des navires ennemis car le blindage du pont était souvent moins épais.

column2: The Righteous Society of Harmonious Fists, known among westerners as 'Boxers', is a Chinese movement dedicated to the restoration of Chinese independence from the, real or perceived, incursions foreign imperialism. Shunning no means in accomplishing their goal of a 'purer' China, this traditionalist movement will -- under the slogan 'Support the Qing, destroy the foreign' -- massacre Europeans and Chinese christian converts at any chance they get.
column3: Les Poings de la justice et de la concorde (ou Boxeurs) est un mouvement chinois luttant pour permettre à la Chine de regagner l'indépendance perdue face aux incursions de l'impérialisme étranger. Ne reculant devant rien pour "purifier" la Chine, ce mouvement traditionnaliste saisira la moindre occasion pour massacrer des Européens et des Chinois convertis au christianisme (en appelant à détruire les étrangers pour soutenir les Qing).

column2: The Boxer Rebellion, or Yihetuan Movement, was a proto-nationalist movement by the Righteous Harmony Society in China which opposed both foreign imperialism and Christianity. Popular sentiment turned against foreign influence in the country, from opium traders to economic manipulation and missionary evangelism, giving rise to very organized revolts.
column3: The Boxer Rebellion, or Yihetuan Movement, was a proto-nationalist movement by the Righteous Harmony Society in China which opposed both foreign imperialism and Christianity. Popular sentiment turned against foreign influence in the country, from opium traders to economic manipulation and missionary evangelism, giving rise to very organized revolts.

column2: Bronislaw Kasper Malinowski was a Polish anthropologist, widely considered one of the most important modern anthropoligists, and also influential in structural functionalist sociology. His pioneering ethnographic fieldwork made a major contribution to the study of Melanesia and of phenomena relating to reciprocity.

Brass is often used for decoration, due to its bright gold-like appearance, but it is also used for applications where low friction is requir3ed such as locks, gears, bearings,ammunition, and valves.

column2: The Franco-Italian adventurer Pierre Savorgnan de Brazza explored the Congo region in the 1870's and 80's, and opened up Central Africa and the right bank of the Congo river to French colonization. The city of Brazzaville in the French Congo was named after him.
column3: Lexplorateur franco-italien Pierre Savorgnan de Brazza explora la région du Congo dans les années 1870 et 1880 et il ouvrit l'Afrique Centrale et la rive occidentale du Congo à la colonisation française. La ville de Brazzaville au Congo français porte son nom.

column2: A breech-loading weapon is a firearm in which the cartridge or shell is inserted or loaded into a chamber integral to the rear portion of a barrel. Although breech-loading weapons were developed as far back as the late 14th century, breech-loading became more successful with improvements in precision engineering and machining in the 19th century.
column3: Une arme à chargement par la culasse est une arme à feu dans laquelle la cartouche ou la coque est inséré ou chargé dans une chambre intégré à la partie arrière d'un canon. Bien que les armes à chargement par la culasse ont été développés dès la fin du 14ème siècle, le chargement par la culasse est devenu plus réussie avec des améliorations dans la mécanique de précision et l'usinage au 19ème siècle.

Elle s'est appuyée sur une plus grande variété de navires que l'école des eaux bleues, mais d'un rapport efficacité/coût également plus efficace car il faut moins de grands bâtiments de guerre chers à l'usage.

column2: Highly critical of Classical theory, Hildebrand spent much of his time attacking Ricardo relentlessly for being materialistic, universalistic and cosmopolitan. Only later in his life did he put his own idea down - in particular, developing a linear 'stages' theory of economic history. His empirical and statistical work, however, did not make much use of these insights.
column3: Hautement critique de la théorie classique, Hildebrand a passé beaucoup de temps à attaquer sans relâche Ricardo d'être matérialiste, universaliste et cosmopolite. C'est seulement plus tard dans sa vie qu'il eut son idée sur le développement de la théorie linéaire des «étapes» de l'histoire économique. Ses travaux empiriques et statistiques, cependant, n'ont pas vu de grand usage de ces idées.

column2: The Gotthard Rail Tunnel was built between 1871 and 1881, connecting the towns of Göschenen and Airolo. The first tunnel ever to be built under the Gotthard Massif, the Gotthard Tunnel was in its time considered an architectural achievement made possible by modern technology.

column2: There is a long history of attempts to build a canal across Nicaragua to connect the Atlantic Ocean with the Pacific Ocean. Construction of such a shipping routeusing the San Juan River as an access route to Lake Nicaraguawas first proposed in the early colonial era. The 259.4 km long canal as planned will have three sections. The West Canal runs from Brito at the Pacific Ocean up the Rio Brito valley, crosses the continental divide, and after passing through the Rio Las Lajas valley enters Lake Nicaragua
column3: There is a long history of attempts to build a canal across Nicaragua to connect the Atlantic Ocean with the Pacific Ocean. column2: Proposals for a Canal across the Panama Isthmus probably date back to the first discovery of the area. Nowhere is the strip of land that unites the North and South American continents thinner than here, and, with the aid of modern engineering, we could shorten the travel time between the Atlantic and The Pacific by several days by building it.
column3: Les propositions de construction d'un canal à travers le détroit de Panama remontent probablement à la première découverte de la région. Nulle part ailleurs une bande de terre reliant les continents nord et sud américains n'est aussi étroite qu'à cet endroit et, grâce à l'ingénierie moderne, nous pourrions raccourcir de plusieurs jours les voyages entre les océans Atlantique et Pacifique.

En construisant le canal de Suez, nous raccourcirons de plusieurs jours les voyages à destination de l'Asie et réaliserons par là même une belle prouesse d'ingénierie moderne.

column2: Built as the entrance arch to the 1889 world's fair, the Eiffel tower is one of the most enduring and iconic symbols of Paris and of French architecture. Named for its designer Gustave Eiffel, the Eiffel tower was the tallest man made structure in the world until the 1930 completion of New York City's Chrysler Building.
column3: Construite comme arche dentrée pour lexposition universelle de 1889, la tour Eiffel est un des symboles les plus représentatif de Paris et de l'architecture française. Elle porte le nom de son concepteur, Gustave Eiffel, et demeura le plus haut monument fait de la main de lhomme jusquà ce que le Chrysler building soit achevé à New York en 1930.

column2: Very little progress has been made in the past few thousand years on that greatest of all building projects initiated by our proud ancestors. With Iraq's recent ascent to power and standing in the world, there is some talk... though all talk has been strangely hard to understand lately... of starting the project back up again! With modern technology, who knows what wonders could be accomplished?

Avec la technologie moderne, qui sait quelles merveilles pourraient être accomplies ?

Permettons aux autres nations d'admirer la gloire de la nouvelle Rome en bâtissant un monument digne de notre jeune nation.

column2: Bullpup describes a modern firearm configuration in which the action is located behind the trigger group and alongside the shooter's face, so there is no wasted space for the buttstock as in conventional designs. This permits a shorter firearm length for the same barrel length for improved maneuverability, and reduces weight.

column2: Civil services, always seeking maximum efficiency, progressively tried to free themselves from political control. They began to set their own sets of regulations and hire their own staff. In other countries, however, civil servants were chosen among political supporters and allies. By use of patronage the administration was thus kept into line.
column3: Les services civils, cherchent toujours le maximum d'efficacité, et progressivement essayent de se libérer de tout contrôle politique. Ils ont commencé à fixer un ensemble de règlements et à engager leur propre personnel. Dans d'autres pays, toutefois, les fonctionnaires ont été choisis parmi les partisans et les alliés. Par l'utilisation du favoritisme, l'administration a donc été maintenue en ligne.

column2: As more individuals became involved in investing in securities markets in the early twentieth century, the practice of buying on margin developed to increase the amount of shares that could be bought with minimal initial overhead. The principal of buying on margin is that if the investment makes a profit, the profit would cover the cost of the commission charged for allowing the purchase of large amounts of securities with only a minimal initial investment. The risk involved in this type of investment is that if the investment shows a loss, the difference between the initial investment and the commission charged for the purchase must be made up by the investor. How low an initial margin was prudent for the securities industry to accept would be the subject of intense debate, as lower margins both allowed investors with limited capital to invest in markets, but raised the risk of default by these limited-capital investors should the investments fail to produce profits
column3: Comme de plus en plus de personnes participaient à l'investissement sur les marchés des valeurs mobilières au début du XXe siècle, la pratique des achats sur marge fut mis au point pour augmenter la quantité d'actions pouvant être achetée avec des frais généraux initiaux minimum. Le principal de l'achat sur marge, c'est que si l'investissement rapporte un bénéfice, le profit doit couvrir le coût de la commission chargée de permettre l'achat de montants importants de titres avec un investissement minimal. Le risque inhérent à ce type d'investissement est que si l'investissement représente une perte, la différence entre l'investissement initial et la commission chargée de l'achat doit être supportée par l'investisseur. Quel niveau de marge initiale restait prudent pour le secteur des valeurs mobilières faisait l'objet d'un intense débat, car la baisse des marges a permis aux investisseurs avec un capital limité d'investir sur les marchés, mais a soulevé le risque de défaillance que ces investissements ne produisent pas les bénéfices attendus.

column2: Having seen the brutality and horror of the aftermath of the battle of Solferino, Jean Henri Dunant, in 1862, published a witness account of the battle called 'Un Souvenir de Solferino' (A Memory of Solferino), printed at his own expense. Drawing on his experiences, Dunant began formulating ideas about setting up an international organization dedicated to the treating of war wounded, and also toured Switzerland extensively to lecture. Against the backdrop of such ideas, the Swiss parliament, in 1864, called an international convention at Geneva to establish international laws for the conduct of war.
column3: Révolté par les dégâts humains de la bataille de Solférino, Jean Henri Dunant, écrit en 1862 un livre intitulé "Un souvenir de Solférino" qu'il publie à ses propres frais. Fort de son expérience, Dunant émet l'idée d'une organisation internationale destinée à soigner les blessés de guerre et donne de nombreuses conférences dans toute la Suisse. S'appuyant sur cette idée, le parlement suisse organise en 1864 à Genève une convention internationale pour établir des règles internationales de protection des personnes lors des conflits armés.

column2: The Confederation of Canada now has self-rule. Our dominion is ours to govern, as a new and emerging power not only within North America but in the world.
column3: The Confederation of Canada now has self-rule. Our dominion is ours to govern, as a new and emerging power not only within North America but in the world.

column2: The candlestick telephone is a style of telephone that was common from the late 1890s to the 1930s. Also known as a desk stand, upright, or a stick phone, it came with or without a rotary dial, and with a ringer box.
column3: The candlestick telephone is a style of telephone that was common from the late 1890s to the 1930s. Also known as a desk stand, upright, or a stick phone, it came with or without a rotary dial, and with a ringer box.

column3: En enrichissant les sols en carbone, on a pu augmenter le rendement des récoltes et limiter le temps de repos des sols.

column2: Before the proliferation of vacuum tube amplifiers in the 1920s, carbon transmitters were the only practical means of obtaining high-level audio signals, and were widely used in telephone systems. Their low cost," inherently high output and ""peaked"" frequency response characteristic were well suited for this application", and their use in new telephone installations continued up to the 1980s, long after they had been replaced by other types of microphones in other applications.
column3: Before the proliferation of vacuum tube amplifiers in the 1920s, carbon transmitters were the only practical means of obtaining high-level audio signals, and were widely used in telephone systems. Their low cost," inherently high output and ""peaked"" frequency response characteristic were well suited for this application", and their use in new telephone installations continued up to the 1980s, long after they had been replaced by other types of microphones in other applications.

column2: Carl Menger has been hailed as one of the three leaders of the 'Marginalist Revolution' of the 1870s, along with William Stanley Jevons and Léon Walras. However, Menger's Grundsätze (Principles), published in 1871, eschewed all the mathematical scaffolding that characterized the works of the other two revolutionaries. As such, many economists have insisted that Menger should be placed apart. In one sense, he can be considered different. Unlike Jevons or Walras, Carl Menger founded a proper 'school of thought' which has more-or-less retained its distinctive character since - namely, the Austrian School. His two disciples at Vienna, Eugen von Böhm-Bawerk and Friedrich von Wieser did much to advance and forge that school.
column3: Carl Menger a été salué comme l'un des trois meneurs de la «révolution marginaliste» des années 1870, avec Stanley Jevons et Léon Walras. Toutefois, 'Grundsätze' de Menger (Principes), publié en 1871, renonce à tout l'échafaudage mathématique qui caractérise les uvres des deux autres révolutionnaires. En tant que tel, de nombreux économistes ont insisté sur le fait que Menger devait être placé à part. En un sens, son oeuvre ne peut être considérée comme différente. Contrairement à Jevons ou à Walras, Carl Menger a fondé une véritable "école de pensée" qui a plus ou moins conservé son caractère distinctif depuis - à savoir, l'école autrichienne. Ses deux disciples à Vienne, Eugen von Böhm-Bawerk et Friedrich von Wieser ont beaucoup contribué à forger l'avance de cette école.

column2: Carlism is a traditionalist and legitimist political movement in Spain seeking the establishment of a separate line of the Bourbon family on the Spanish throne. This line descended from Infante Carlos, Count of Molina, and was founded due to dispute over the succession laws and widespread dissatisfaction with the Alfonsine line of the House of Bourbon.
column3: Carlism is a traditionalist and legitimist political movement in Spain seeking the establishment of a separate line of the Bourbon family on the Spanish throne. This line descended from Infante Carlos, Count of Molina, and was founded due to dispute over the succession laws and widespread dissatisfaction with the Alfonsine line of the House of Bourbon.

column2: The Carlists are a traditionalist and legitimist movement in Spain. Feeling threatened both politically and economically by the ideology and tenants of liberalism, and feeling special hatred for the anti-clerical progresistas, who are clearly masonic puppets, with their hatred of church and tradition. They feel that true security can only come about through strong rule by the true heir of Infante Don Carlos.
column3: Les carlistes forment un mouvement traditionaliste et légitimiste en Espagne. Ils se sentent menacés, politiquement et économiquement, par l'idéologie libéraliste et éprouvent une grande haine à l'égard des progressistes anticléricaux qui sont clairement pour eux, des marionnettes maçonniques qui haïssent l'Église et la tradition. Ils estiment que seul le véritable héritier de l'infant Don Carlos peut assurer la sécurité du pays.

column3: A Carlist cell is at work in the province, and is quickly gaining sympathy for the rebels that wish to topple the Spanish government.

column2: The carronade was a short smoothbore,cast iron cannon, It was used from the 1770s to the 1850s. Its main function was to serve as a powerful, short-range anti-ship and anti-crew weapon. While considered very successful early on, carronades eventually disappeared as long-range naval artillery led to fewer and fewer close-range engagements.
column3: The carronade was a short smoothbore,cast iron cannon, It was used from the 1770s to the 1850s. Its main function was to serve as a powerful, short-range anti-ship and anti-crew weapon. While considered very successful early on, carronades eventually disappeared as long-range naval artillery led to fewer and fewer close-range engagements.

column2: Caseless ammunition is a type of small arms ammunition that eliminates the cartridge case that typically holds the primer, propellant, and projectile together as a unit. Caseless ammunition is an attempt to reduce the weight and cost of ammunition by dispensing with the case, which is typically precision made of brass or steel, as well as simplify the operation of repeating firearms by eliminating the need to extract and eject the empty case after firing.
column3: Caseless ammunition is a type of small arms ammunition that eliminates the cartridge case that typically holds the primer, propellant, and projectile together as a unit. Caseless ammunition is an attempt to reduce the weight and cost of ammunition by dispensing with the case, which is typically precision made of brass or steel, as well as simplify the operation of repeating firearms by eliminating the need to extract and eject the empty case after firing.

column2: An early goal of British Imperialists in India was to create a class of local elites in their own image. They were successful, forming a new caste of wealthy Indians who rose to prominence within the colony.
column3: An early goal of British Imperialists in India was to create a class of local elites in their own image. They were successful, forming a new caste of wealthy Indians who rose to prominence within the colony.

column2: This marked the beginning of a new field of science and technology  - biotechnology. Connstein and Norman combined fermentative processes (enzymatic hydrolization) with a thermodynamic process (catalytic hydrogenation). One result of this combination was margarine, which greatly improved the supply of the population with essential unsaturated fatty acids.
column3: Ce procédé marqua la création d'une nouvelle doctrine mélant science et technologie : la biotechnologie. Connstein et Norman combinérent le procédé de fermentation (hydrolisation enzymatique) avec un procédé thermodynamique (hydrogénation catalytique). L'un des résultat de ce procédé fut la margarine, qui améliora grandement le ravitaillement de la population en acides gras essentiels non-saturés.

column2: New methods of breeding livestock have led to a boom in cattle and horse populations, and permitted the average rancher far more control over the quality of his stock.

column2: As more radical ideological alternatives to liberal democracy gained power in the early twentieth century, the opportunity to reconstruct economic organization based on State direction of economic activity that could be compared to the relative success or failure of traditional market-based economic structures arose. Such programs of centralized economic planning, employed by both communist and right-wing regimes, often achieved dramatic initial results in reducing unemployment, increasing output of industrial goods, and removing the problem of conflict between laborer and employer in society, which the regimes would trumpet as proof of the superiority of their systems over free market systems. The social and economic costs to these societies, however, were often very high, and the resistance to State control created the potential for brutal repression. However, to the outside world that new little of the negative consequences of these plans, they seemed to suggest a viable alternative to the free-market systems that had been the hallmark of nineteenth century economic theory.
column3: De plus en plus d'alternatives idéologiques radicales à la démocratie libérale ont pris l'ascendance au début du XXe siècle, avec la possibilité de reconstruire l'organisation économique fondée sur l'orientation d'État de l'activité économique qui pouvait être comparée à la réussite ou l'échec relatif des marchés traditionnels à base de structures économiques. Ces programmes de planification économique centralisée, employés par les deux régimes communistes et fascistes, souvent réalisent leurs premiers résultats dans la réduction drastique du chômage, l'augmentation de la production de biens industriels, et la suppression du problème de conflit entre employeur et travailleur dans la société, donc ces régimes « trompettent » comme preuve de la supériorité de leurs systèmes sur les systèmes du marché libre. Les coûts sociaux et économiques, toutefois, étaient souvent très élevés, et la résistance au contrôle de l'État a créé le potentiel de répressions brutales. Cependant, pour le monde extérieur peu au fait des conséquences néfastes de cette planification, cela semblait suggérer une alternative viable aux systèmes du libre marché qui ont été la marque du XIXe siècle.

column2: Charles Spearman was a British psychologist and mathematician. Spearman criticized Galton's tests as being too simple to measure intelligence. He preferred Binet's test, but criticized the use of a universal number to characterize different areas of intelligence. He developed the process of factor analysis, measuring correlations between performance in different test areas. He proposed two underlying factors 'g' for general intelligence to explain the correlations and 's' for specific abilities to explain the imperfections in his correlations. His 'g'factor was not a concrete number, but he too believed in the heritability of intelligence.
column3: Charles Spearman was a British psychologist and mathematician. Spearman criticized Galton's tests as being too simple to measure intelligence. He preferred Binet's test, but criticized the use of a universal number to characterize different areas of intelligence. He developed the process of factor analysis, measuring correlations between performance in different test areas. He proposed two underlying factors 'g' for general intelligence to explain the correlations and 's' for specific abilities to explain the imperfections in his correlations. His 'g'factor was not a concrete number, but he too believed in the heritability of intelligence.

column2: Carl von Clausewitz was a Prussian soldier and German military theorist who stressed the moral and political aspects of war. He espoused a romantic or Hegelian conception of warfare, stressing the dialectic of how opposite factors interact, and noting how unexpected new developments unfolding under the fog of war called for rapid decisions by alert commanders. Clausewitz saw history as a complex check on abstractions that did not accord with experience.

Clausewitz saw history as a complex check on abstractions that did not accord with experience.

column2: Since the beginning of the Qing dynasty, the Chinese Imperial administration and bureaucracy had been dominated by a powerful Manchu elite, and the Qing emperors had traditionally discriminated heavily against ethnic Han. In the 1860s, Empress Dowager Cixi effectively ended this practice, when she entrusted the country's most powerful military unit to a man of Han background, Zeng Guofan, during the suppression of the Taiping rebellion. By getting rid of the Manchu elite, we can take an important step toward modernization.
column3: Depuis le début de la dynastie Qing, l'administration et la bureaucratie de l'Empire chinois sont dominées par une puissante élite mandchoue et les empereurs Qing se sont attachés à discriminer l'ethnie Han. Dans les années 1860, l'impératrice Dowager Cixi mit fin à cette pratique et confia le commandement de la plus puissante unité militaire du pays à un homme d'origine Han, Zeng Guofan, au cours de la suppression de la rébellion Taiping. En nous débarrassant de l'élite mandchoue, nous pourrons faire un important pas en avant vers la modernisation.

column2: In the aftermath of the First World War, the major powers put an increasing emphasis on what came to be known as combined operations. This represented the utilization of land, sea, and air forces together to achieve a single strategic objective. Often revolving around amphibious operations, combined operations often fit within larger naval strategic objectives, including the destruction of enemy naval assets and the securing of sealanes. No longer could navies operate in isolation from the other branches of the military, and the development of new tactics was required to integrate naval warfare into the larger strategic perspective.
column3: Au lendemain de la Première Guerre mondiale, les grandes puissances ont mis davantage l'accent sur ce qui allait être connu sous le nom d'opérations combinées. Cela représente l'utilisation des forces terrestres, des forces navales, et des forces de l'air de concert pour atteindre un objectif stratégique unique. Souvent tournant autour d'opérations amphibies, ces opérations combinées entrent dans les grands objectifs stratégiques de la marine, incluant la destruction des moyens ennemis et la sécurisation des voies maritimes. La marine ne pouvait plus fonctionner en vase clos des autres branches de l'armée, et le développement de nouvelles tactiques a été nécessaire pour intégrer le combat naval dans une plus grande perspective stratégique.

column2: Commerce Raiders are usually commercial vessels re-equipped with guns and sometimes torpedoes that can out-run most military vessels and aim to disrupt enemy commercial shipping lanes.
column3: Les navires marchands militarisés sont généralement des navires de commerce armés de canons, parfois de torpilles, et capables de semer la plupart des navires de guerre. Leur mission est de couper les routes commerciales maritimes de l'ennemi.

column2: The Far East remains an enigma, and one which is beyond the reach of most western powers due to the enforced seclusion of China and Japan. While China is largely spoken for, Japan remains a potential target for American influence to expand. If we are to be taken seriously as a world power, we must consider sending a force to negotiate for trade rights with the Japanese-- under the threat of military force, if necessary.
column3: The Far East remains an enigma, and one which is beyond the reach of most western powers due to the enforced seclusion of China and Japan. While China is largely spoken for, Japan remains a potential target for American influence to expand. If we are to be taken seriously as a world power, we must consider sending a force to negotiate for trade rights with the Japanese-- under the threat of military force, if necessary.

column2: The Commonwealth of Nations is an intergovernmental organization of states affiliated with the former British Empire and recognize the King or Queen of England as Head of the Commonwealth, and for some member-states, also the Head of State. Although the member-states have no legal obligation to one another, they are united by language, history, culture, and their shared values of democracy, human rights, and the rule of law, as enshrined in the Commonwealth Charter and promoted by the Commonwealth Games.
column3: The Commonwealth of Nations is an intergovernmental organization of states affiliated with the former British Empire and recognize the King or Queen of England as Head of the Commonwealth, and for some member-states, also the Head of State. Although the member-states have no legal obligation to one another, they are united by language, history, culture, and their shared values of democracy, human rights, and the rule of law, as enshrined in the Commonwealth Charter and promoted by the Commonwealth Games.

column2: The Red Guards are communists who have risen in open rebellion against the government, and, more importantly, against all of what they consider to be the reactionary trappings of the bourgeois state, and even society. In opposition to the institutions of religion, tradition, private ownership and family, these revolutionaries seek instead to establish a 'Dictatorship of The Proletariat', the first step on the long, corpse-strewn way to the promised classless utopia of Communism.
column3: Les Gardes Rouges sont des communistes qui sont entrés en rebellion ouverte contre le gouvernement, et plus important encore, contre tout ce qu'ils considèrent être des attributs réactionnaires de l'Etat bourgeois, jusqu'à être contre la société. En opposition aux institutions religieuses, à la tradition, à la propriété privée et à la famille, ces révolutionnaires cherchent à établir une "dictature du prolétariat", premier pas sur le long chemin jonché de corps menant vers l'utopie sans classes du communisme.

column2: This region is considered a stronghold of communist support within the country.
column3: This region is considered a stronghold of communist support within the country.

column2: Communists want to enact social reforms, but want to see political reforms rolled back.
column3: Les communistes veulent davantage de réformes sociales et le retrait des réformes politiques.

column2: Many decades have passed since the defeat of the Swedish armies in the Finnish War, and the passing of our country's eastern half to captivity under the Russian Eagle. Although reports from Finland speak of widespread discontent with Russian rule, very few seem to yearn for a reunification with Sweden, instead preferring to seek direct Finnish independence and autonomy. Some say it is time for us to abandon all thoughts of a Swedish return to Finland
column3: Plusieurs décennies se sont écoulées depuis la défaite des armées suédoises dans la Guerre de Finlande, et le passage de la moitié orientale de notre pays à la captivité sous le joug de l'aigle russe. Bien que les rapports de Finlande parlent du mécontentement général causé par la domination russe, peu semblent aspirer à une réunification avec la Suède, et préfèrent directement solliciter l'indépendance de la Finlande. Certains disent qu'il est temps pour nous d'abandonner tout espoir d'un retour de la Suède en Finlande.

column2: The make-up of our country's population has changed so much and so rapidly that it is clear an effort must be undertaken to catalogue our population. Let us discover who is who in our nation.
column3: The make-up of our country's population has changed so much and so rapidly that it is clear an effort must be undertaken to catalogue our population. Let us discover who is who in our nation.
