column2: James Mill was a radical thinker that worked in the shadows of the brilliant, Jeremy Bentham. Together these two men can be described as the inventors of Utilitarianism, and much of its general applicability was explained in Mills works, Elements of Political Economy (1821) and Analysis of the Phenomenon of the Human Mind (1829).
column3: James Mill était un penseur radical qui a travaillé dans l'ombre du brillant Jeremy Bentham. Ensemble, ces deux hommes peuvent être décrits comme les inventeurs de l'utilitarisme, et une grande partie de son applicabilité générale a été expliquée dans les uvres de Mills, éléments d'économie politique (1821) et de l'analyse du phénomène de l'esprit humain (1829).

column2: Originating in the fusion of Western musical tradition with elements of traditional African music, Jazz evolved out of the nightclubs of New Orleans in the southern United States in the early twentieth century. Its blend of frenetic, intoxicating rhythms, powerful melodies which encouraged improvisation by performers to add their own distinctive touches to each performance, and energetic vocals would hit upon the world just as new technologies to spread new music, such as the phonograph record, radio and sound cinema, provided a platform to showcase it to a worldwide audience. In the 1920s it became one of the dominant forms of popular music in the world, though many of the traditional arbiters of taste frowned upon its popularity as further proof that society was rebelling against proper authority
column3: Originaire de la fusion de la tradition musicale occidentale avec des éléments de musique traditionnelle africaine, le jazz a évolué à partir des boîtes de nuit de la Nouvelle-Orléans dans le sud des États-Unis au début du XXe siècle. Son mélange de frentic, enivrants rythmes, mélodies puissantes qui encourageaient l'improvisation ou des artistes ajoutent leur touche personnelle à chaque performance. Ce chant énergique a frappé le monde tout comme les nouvelles technologies pour diffuser la musique nouvelle, comme le disque de phonographe, la radio et le cinéma sonore, qui a fourni une plate-forme pour le jazz présenté avec une audience mondiale. Dans les années 1920, il est devenu l'une des formes dominantes de la musique populaire dans le monde, bien que de nombreux arbitres traditionnels du bon goût désapprouvaient sa popularité comme une preuve supplémentaire que la société se rebellait contre l'autorité établie.

column2: John Broadus Watson was an American psychologist who studied Pavlovian conditioning in humans. Watson's most famous experiment involved conditioning an 11-year old child named Albert to associate a conditioned stimulus (fear of rats) to an unconditioned stimulus (fear of a loud hammering sound). Watson's research later led to clinical treatments extinguishing irrational fears in people. After being dismissed from Harvard over an affair and marriage with a graduate student, Watson brought his research experience to a prominent advertising firm. Modern advertising owed much to behaviorist psychology and conditioning concepts.
column3: John Broadus Watson was an American psychologist who studied Pavlovian conditioning in humans. Watson's most famous experiment involved conditioning an 11-year old child named Albert to associate a conditioned stimulus (fear of rats) to an unconditioned stimulus (fear of a loud hammering sound). Watson's research later led to clinical treatments extinguishing irrational fears in people. After being dismissed from Harvard over an affair and marriage with a graduate student, Watson brought his research experience to a prominent advertising firm. Modern advertising owed much to behaviorist psychology and conditioning concepts.

column2: Jean-Baptiste Say was a French scholar active in the field of political economy. A contemporary of Adam Smith, he also advocated economic competition and freedom of trade. He wrote the Traité d'économie politique ou simple exposition de la manière dont se forment, se distribuent et se composent les richesses, originally published in 1803. Say's Law of Markets was derived thus from his treatise, 'Inherent in supply is the wherewithal for its own consumption.'
column3: Jean-Baptiste Say was a French scholar active in the field of political economy. A contemporary of Adam Smith, he also advocated economic competition and freedom of trade. He wrote the Traité d'économie politique ou simple exposition de la manière dont se forment, se distribuent et se composent les richesses, originally published in 1803. Say's Law of Markets was derived thus from his treatise, 'Inherent in supply is the wherewithal for its own consumption.'

column2: Jaurès was elected to the Chamber of Deputies in 1885. Defeated in the 1889 elections he returned to the University of Toulouse. He became increasingly radical in his political views and after reading Karl Marx he began advocating socialism. He was not a revolutionary and supported the Independent Socialists. While out of parliament Jaurès completed his mammoth Socialist History of the French Revolution. He also joined with Aristide Briand and Rene Viviani in 1904 to establish the left-wing newspaper, L'Humanité in 1904. A new Socialist Party under Jaurès grew rapidly at the beginning of the century but split over the correct response to German militarism. Jaurès advocated a policy of international arbitration whereas others supported the Triple Entente.
column3: Jaurès a été élu à la Chambre des députés en 1885. Battu aux élections de 1889, il est retourné à l'université de Toulouse. Il est devenu de plus en plus radical dans ses opinions politiques et à la lecture de Karl Marx, il a commencé à se revendiquer du socialisme. Il n'était pas un révolutionnaire et il a soutenu les socialistes indépendants. Bien que parlementaire, Jaurès a achevé son monumental "Histoire socialiste de la Révolution française". Il s'est également joint à Aristide Briand et à René Viviani en 1904 pour établir le journal de gauche, L'Humanité. Un nouveau parti socialiste sous l'aile de Jaurès s'est développé rapidement au début du siècle, mais le parti est resté diviser sur la réponse correcte à apporter au militarisme allemand. Jaurès a préconisé une politique de l'arbitrage international, tandis que d'autres ont soutenu la Triple Entente.

column2: The Jefferson Method is a highest averages method for allocating seats.
column3: La méthode de Jefferson correspond à la méthode des moyennes les plus hautes pour attribuer des sièges.

column2: A noted British mathematical physicist who pioneered work in artificial intelligence.
column3: A noted British mathematical physicist who pioneered work in artificial intelligence.

column2: The introduction of jiggs vastly increased the efficiency of all machines, which in its turn helped increase most industrial production.
column3: La mise en place de gabarits a considérablement amélioré l'efficacité des machines et, indirectement, augmenta la production industrielle.

column2: The Jim Crow laws mandate de jure racial segregation in all public facilities, with a supposedly 'separate but equal' status for black Americans.
column3: The Jim Crow laws mandate de jure racial segregation in all public facilities, with a supposedly 'separate but equal' status for black Americans.

column2: The military is the centrepiece of the state and military spending is prioritised.
column3: L'armée est la pièce maîtresse de l'État et les dépenses militaires sont privilégiées.

column2: Johann Heinrich von Thünen was a North German landowner from the Mecklenburg area. Although educated at Göttingen, he spent most of his life managing his rural estate, Tellow.  In the first volume of his treatise, The Isolated State (1826), he laid down the first serious treatment of spatial economics, connecting with the theory of rent.  His second volume (1850) developed the essence of the marginal productivity theory of distribution in a mathematically precise way, thereby making one of the most important Proto-Marginalists of the era. Nearing his death, he asked that his famous equation for the marginal product of labor, or natural wage, be carved into his tombstone.
column3: Johann Heinrich von Thünen était un propriétaire terrien d'Allemagne du nord de la région de Mecklembourg. Bien qu'éduqué à Göttingen, il a passé presque toute sa vie à la gestion de son domaine rural, Tellow. Dans le premier volume de son traité, État isolé (1826), il a posé le premier traitement sérieux de l'économie spatiale, la connexion avec la théorie de la rente. Son second volume (1850) a développé l'essence de la théorie de la productivité marginale dans la distribution d'une façon mathématiquement précise, le faisant ainsi l'un des plus importants proto-marginalistes de l'époque. Sentant approché sa mort, il a demandé que sa fameuse équation de la productivité marginale du travail, ou salaire naturel, soit gravé sur sa pierre tombale.

column2: John Elliot Cairnes was a follower of John Stuart Mill. His Slave Power (1862), a defense of the North in the American Civil War, made a great impression in England. He has written about noncompeting groups in the labor market and is known for his distrust of mathematical economics. Among his works are The Character and Logical Method of Political Economy (1857) and Some Leading Principles of Political Economy Newly Expounded (1874).
column3: John Elliot Cairnes était un disciple de John Stuart Mill. Son oeuvre "Slave Power" (1862), une défense du Nord dans la guerre civile américaine, a fait grande impression en Angleterre. Il a écrit sur les groupes non concurrentiels dans le marché du travail et est connu pour sa méfiance à l'égard de l'économie mathématique. Citons parmi ses uvres : le caractère et la méthode logique de l'économie politique (1857) et certains principes avancés de l'économie politique nouvellement exposée (1874).

column2: An English economist who challenged the orthodox view of the role of the State in the management of economic forces in society and the relationship between supply and demand in times of economic crisis. Drawing upon the abilities of states to mobilize their economies during wars with other industrial nations, Keynes maintained that the State could use its influence to promote more efficient economic development. But his most radical theory involved the role of aggregate demand in the economy, arguing that it was demand, not supply, that was the final determinant in the levels of output and growth that an economy could produce, and that in times of economic slowdown or crisis, the solution to the crisis involved revival of demand to absorb excess supply and create the conditions for a revival of production to meet further increases in demand. While his theories had many critics, they became highly influential as the twentieth century progressed
column3: Un économiste anglais qui a contesté le point de vue orthodoxe du rôle de l'État dans la gestion des forces économiques dans la société et la relation entre l'offre et la demande en période de crise économique. S'appuyant sur les capacités des Etats à mobiliser leurs économies au cours des guerres contre d'autres pays industrialisés, Keynes a soutenu que l'Etat pourrait user de son influence pour promouvoir plus efficacement le développement économique. Mais sa théorie la plus radicale remet en cause le rôle de la demande globale dans l'économie, faisant valoir que c'est la demande, pas l'approvisionnement, qui a été le facteur déterminant pour les niveaux de production et de croissance que l'économie pourrait produire, et qu'en période de ralentissement économique ou crise, la solution à la crise impliquait la reprise de la demande pour absorber l'offre excédentaire et créer les conditions d'une relance de la production pour répondre à de nouvelles augmentations de la demande. Bien que ses théories ont essuyé beaucoup de critiques, elles sont devenus très influentes au cours du vingtième siècle.

column2: A prolific Scottish journalist, John Ramsay McCulloch was one of the most ardent and doctrinaire expositors of the Classical Ricardian School. McCulloch began his career as the editor of The Scotsman, eventually moving on to the whiggish Edinburgh Review, where he served as economics editor until the late 1830s. McCulloch used his position at the Review to popularize the Classical theories and promote his favorite economic policies, such as the repeal of the Corn Laws, the retention of the Poor Laws and the legalization of trade unions. McCulloch also lectured on political economy at University College London from 1828 to 1832. In 1838, he was appointed the Comptroller of HM Stationary Office. McCulloch's main work, Principles (1825), was perhaps the first successful 'serious' textbook in economics (and a rather loyal reading of Ricardo's theory). However, McCulloch is often considered a 'lightweight' in terms of the development of economic theory. His main contribution was the ill-fated 'wages fund' doctrine (1824, 1825, 1826). McCulloch was also the editor of the 1828 edition of Adam Smith's Wealth of Nations and the 1846 edition of David Ricardo's Works. He also composed some of the earliest accounts of the history of economic thought (naturally, flattering to the Ricardians).  His monumental 1837 treatise provides a statistical account of the failure of the Malthusian population doctrine.
column3: Un prolifique journaliste écossais, John Ramsay McCulloch est l'un des commentateurs les plus ardents et doctrinaires de l'école classique ricardienne. McCulloch a commencé sa carrière comme rédacteur en chef de The Scotsman, avant de passer à la whig revue d'Edimbourg, où il a été rédacteur économique jusqu'à la fin des années 1830. McCulloch s'est servi de sa position à la revue pour populariser les théories classiques et promouvoir ses politiques favorites économiques, telles que l'abrogation des Corn Laws, le maintien de la loi sur les pauvres et la légalisation des syndicats. McCulloch a également donné des conférences sur l'économie politique à l'University College de Londres de 1828 à 1832. En 1838, il a été nommé contrôleur des HM Stationary Office. Le principal travail de McCulloch, Principes (1825), était peut-être le premier succès sérieux en terme de manuel d'économie (et une lecture assez fidèle de la théorie de Ricardo). Toutefois, McCulloch est souvent considérée comme "léger" en termes de développement de la théorie économique. Sa principale contribution a été la doctrine de l'infortuné «fonds des salaires» (1824, 1825, 1826). McCulloch était également le rédacteur en chef de l'édition 1828 du patrimoine d'Adam Smith des Nations Unies et de l'édition 1846 de Travaux David Ricardo. Il a également composé quelques-uns des premiers récits de l'histoire de la pensée économique (naturellement, flatteur pour les ricardiens). Son monumental traité de 1837 présente un compte rendu statistique de l'échec de la doctrine malthusienne de la population.

column2: John Stuart Mill was the son of James Mill, the famous utilitarian, he quickly became known as one of the more brilliant minds of the United Kingdom, and also one of the more radical. He published several books among them A System of Logic (1843), Principles of Political Economy (1848), On Liberty (1859), Considerations on Representative Government (1861) and Utilitarianism (1861), all of which made him the centre-figure of social liberalism and a more humane view of society.
column3: John Stuart Mill était le fils de James Mill, le célèbre utilitaire, il est rapidement devenu connu comme l'un des esprits les plus brillants du Royaume-Uni, et aussi l'un des plus radical. Il a publié plusieurs livres parmi eux : Système de logique (1843), Principes d'économie politique (1848), De la liberté (1859), Considérations sur le gouvernement représentatif (1861) et l'utilitarisme (1861), qui fait de lui la figure de prou du social-liberalisme en une vision plus humaine de la société.

column2: The people have called on us to unite under the California banner. Long live the Sons of Liberty!
column3: The people have called on us to unite under the California banner. Long live the Sons of Liberty!

column2: The Commonwealth of Nations is an intergovernmental organization of nations associated with the former British Empire. The Commonwealth dates back to the end of the Second World War and the decolonization of the British Empire and advocates free and equal association. Rather than share a legal obligation to one another, member-states are united by language, history, culture, and their shared values of democracy, human rights, and rule of law set forth by the Commonwealth Charter and promoted by the Commonwealth Games. A potential member-state should have a link to a pre-existing member-state, not necessarily being associated with the former British Empire itself. More importantly, it should strive to uphold the ideals set forth by the Commonwealth Charter.
column3: The Commonwealth of Nations is an intergovernmental organization of nations associated with the former British Empire. The Commonwealth dates back to the end of the Second World War and the decolonization of the British Empire and advocates free and equal association. Rather than share a legal obligation to one another, member-states are united by language, history, culture, and their shared values of democracy, human rights, and rule of law set forth by the Commonwealth Charter and promoted by the Commonwealth Games. A potential member-state should have a link to a pre-existing member-state, not necessarily being associated with the former British Empire itself. More importantly, it should strive to uphold the ideals set forth by the Commonwealth Charter.

column2: Our position on the North American continent, and our traditional cultural ties to Canada, make it likely that Canada would be willing to negotiate our entrance into confederation. Doing this means our country will be annexed by Canada.
column3: Our position on the North American continent, and our traditional cultural ties to Canada, make it likely that Canada would be willing to negotiate our entrance into confederation. Doing this means our country will be annexed by Canada.

column2: The European Free Trade Organization (EFTA) is a free trade organization that was established as a trade bloc-alternative for European states that were either unable or unwilling to join the European Economic Community (EEC).  Because we are not members of the EEC, we may want to consider applying to EFTA.
column3: The European Free Trade Organization (EFTA) is a free trade organization that was established as a trade bloc-alternative for European states that were either unable or unwilling to join the European Economic Community (EEC).  Because we are not members of the EEC, we may want to consider applying to EFTA.

column2: Join the European Free Trade Organization
column3: Join the European Free Trade Organization

column2: We can potentially become part of the European Economic Community (EEC), an international organization whose aim is to bring about economic integration, including a common market, among its member-states. With the stated goal of preserving peace and liberty and to lay the foundations of an even closer union among the peoples of Europe, many of our people see this as the first step to greater European integration and better representation in international affairs.
column3: We can potentially become part of the European Economic Community (EEC), an international organization whose aim is to bring about economic integration, including a common market, among its member-states. With the stated goal of preserving peace and liberty and to lay the foundations of an even closer union among the peoples of Europe, many of our people see this as the first step to greater European integration and better representation in international affairs.

column2: The people have called on us to unite under the new FSA banner. Long live the Sons of Liberty!
column3: The people have called on us to unite under the new FSA banner. Long live the Sons of Liberty!

column2: The time has come for our nation to take part in the growing Scandinavian union.
column3: The time has come for our nation to take part in the growing Scandinavian union.

column2: The North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) is a military alliance of states in Europe and North America whose organization constitutes a system of collective defense. A non-member may join NATO at the unanimous approval all pre-existing member-states, and typically, NATO will only accept democratic nations who share their ideals and values. Actually becoming a member-state may take some time, but NATO nevertheless looks forward to working with you and your people to protect and defend the democratic values that it holds dear.
column3: The North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) is a military alliance of states in Europe and North America whose organization constitutes a system of collective defense. A non-member may join NATO at the unanimous approval all pre-existing member-states, and typically, NATO will only accept democratic nations who share their ideals and values. Actually becoming a member-state may take some time, but NATO nevertheless looks forward to working with you and your people to protect and defend the democratic values that it holds dear.

column2: The people have called on us to unite under the New America banner. Long live the Sons of Liberty!
column3: The people have called on us to unite under the New America banner. Long live the Sons of Liberty!

column2: The people have called on us to unite under the new Confederate banner. Long live the South!
column3: The people have called on us to unite under the new Confederate banner. Long live the South!

column2: Now that we control Beijing, we are in a position to aid the cause of Nationalist China. We must join our forces with theirs, for the good of all!
column3: Now that we control Beijing, we are in a position to aid the cause of Nationalist China. We must join our forces with theirs, for the good of all!

column2: This legislation increased the possibilities for firms to get infusions of capital in an effective way. It also gave private investors the highest possible return on investment at a certain risk.
column3: Cette législation améliorait les possibilités qu'avaient les entreprises de collecter des capitaux de manière efficace. Elle fournissait aussi aux investisseurs privés le meilleur retour sur investissement possible, à un certain risque.

column2: Antoine-Henri Jomini was a general in the French and later Russian service, and one of the most celebrated writers on the Napoleonic art of war. He took the view that the amount of force deployed should be kept to the minimum in order to lower casualties and that war was a science, not an art. While in Russian service, Jomini tried hard to promote a more scientific approach at the general staff academy he helped found.
column3: Antoine-Henri Jomini was a general in the French and later Russian service, and one of the most celebrated writers on the Napoleonic art of war. He took the view that the amount of force deployed should be kept to the minimum in order to lower casualties and that war was a science, not an art. While in Russian service, Jomini tried hard to promote a more scientific approach at the general staff academy he helped found.

column2: Joseph Lister was a British surgeon and a pioneer of antiseptic surgery, who promoted the idea of sterile surgery while working at the Glasgow Royal Infirmary. Lister successfully introduced carbolic acide to sterilise surgical instruments and to clean wounds, which led to reducing post-operative infections and made surgery safer for patients.
column3: Joseph Lister was a British surgeon and a pioneer of antiseptic surgery, who promoted the idea of sterile surgery while working at the Glasgow Royal Infirmary. Lister successfully introduced carbolic acide to sterilise surgical instruments and to clean wounds, which led to reducing post-operative infections and made surgery safer for patients.

column2: After a quick doctorate at Vienna, Schumpeter roamed about as something of a footloose lawyer until he rejoined academia in 1909. It was while he was teaching at Czernowitz (now in the Ukraine) that he wrote his Theory of Economic Development (1911), where he first outlined his famous theory of entrepreneurship. He argued those daring spirits, entrepreneurs, created technical and financial innovations in the face of competition and falling profits - and that it was these spurts of activity which generated (irregular) economic growth. In 1919, Schumpeter became the Austrian Minister of Finance - unfortunately, presiding over the hyperinflation of the period, and thus was dismissed later that year. Although excelling as a teacher above everything, Joseph Schumpeter nonetheless completed three more books while at Harvard: his didactic Business Cycles (1939), his popular Capitalism, Socialism and Democracy (1942) - in which he famously predicted the downfall of capitalism in the hands of intellectuals.
column3: Après un rapide doctorat à Vienne, Schumpeter errait comme un avocat sans attache jusqu'à ce qu'il rejoigne une université en 1909. C'est alors professeur à Czernowitz (aujourd'hui en Ukraine) qu'il a écrit sa Théorie du développement économique (1911), où il a présenté sa fameuse théorie de l'esprit d'entreprise. Il a fait valoir que des esprits audacieux, entrepreneurs, créent des innovations techniques et financières face à la concurrence et à la baisse des bénéfices - et que ce sont ces poussées de l'activité qui générent (irrégulièrement) de la croissance économique. En 1919, Schumpeter est devenu le ministre autrichien des Finances - fâcheusement, il présida l'hyperinflation de la période, et dut donc démissionner plus tard de la même année. Bien qu'excellant en tant que professeur au dessus de tout, Joseph Schumpeter n'en a pas moins terminé trois livres de plus à Harvard : son didactique Cycle des affaires (1939), son populaire Capitalisme, Socialisme et Démocratie (1942) - dans lequel il prédit la chute du capitalisme dans les mains des intellectuels.

column2: Jules Dupuit was perhaps the most illustrious of the French engineer-economists. Trained at the École des Ponts et Chaussées in Paris, Dupuit had a distinguished career as a civil engineer. From his work with infrastructure he was inspired to develop economic theory deeper.
column3: Jules Dupuit était peut-être le plus illustre ingénieur-économiste français. Formé à l'École des ponts et chaussées de Paris, Dupuit eut une brillante carrière comme ingénieur civil. De son travail sur les infrastructures, il a été inspiré pour élaborer une théorie économique plus profonde.

column2: Carl Gustav Jung was a Swiss psychiatrist, an influential thinker, and the founder of analytical psychology. Jung is often considered the first modern psychologist to state that the human psyche is 'by nature religious' and to explore it in depth. Those not the first to analyze dreams, he has become perhaps one of the most well-known pioneers in the field of dream analysis. Unlike Freud, he was a self-described natural scientist and not a theoretical psychologist. For Jung this salient distinction revolved around his initial process of deep observation followed by categorizations rather than the reverse process of imagining what categories exist and then proceeding to seek for proof of and then discover that one was correct.
column3: Carl Gustav Jung was a Swiss psychiatrist, an influential thinker, and the founder of analytical psychology. Jung is often considered the first modern psychologist to state that the human psyche is 'by nature religious' and to explore it in depth. Those not the first to analyze dreams, he has become perhaps one of the most well-known pioneers in the field of dream analysis. Unlike Freud, he was a self-described natural scientist and not a theoretical psychologist. For Jung this salient distinction revolved around his initial process of deep observation followed by categorizations rather than the reverse process of imagining what categories exist and then proceeding to seek for proof of and then discover that one was correct.

column2: Named after the German Emperor, 'Kaiser-Wilhelms-Land' was the German name for the North Eastern Part of the island of New Guinea, which, together with the Bismarck Archipelago and other pacific holdings constituted the German colony of Neuguinea. The territory was occupied by Australian troops during World War One, and held as a League of Nations mandate until 1975.
column3: Formé sur le nom de lempereur dAllemagne, le « Kaiser-Wilhelms-Land » est le nom allemand de la partie nord-est de la Nouvelle Guinée, qui constitue avec larchipel Bismarck et dautres possessions dans le Pacifique, les colonies allemandes de Neuguinea. Ce territoire fut occupé par lAustralie au cours de la Première guerre mondiale, et resta sous mandat de la Ligue des Nations jusquen 1975.

column2: We have agreed in principle to a closer bond with the other Scandinavian nations.
column3: We have agreed in principle to a closer bond with the other Scandinavian nations.

column2: With enough pressure placed on the Japanese, they will be forced to the negotiating table. A treaty can be hammered out at Kanagawa which will see Japan opened to outside trade and influence, and our superiority proven beyond the shadow of a doubt.
column3: With enough pressure placed on the Japanese, they will be forced to the negotiating table. A treaty can be hammered out at Kanagawa which will see Japan opened to outside trade and influence, and our superiority proven beyond the shadow of a doubt.

column2: By enacting The Kansas-Nebraska act we will effectively repeal the Missouri Compromise of 1820, and allow popular sovereignty to determine whether slavery should or should not be allowed in the former Colony of Louisiana, and the territories presently created out of it. Abolitionists will resent us for it, but it might be necessary to prevent the sundering of our Union.
column3: En promulgant l'acte Kansas-Nebraska nous allons effectivement abroger le compromis du Missouri de 1820, et permettre à la souveraineté populaire de déterminer si l'esclavage devrait ou ne devrait pas être autorisé dans l'ancienne colonie de la Louisiane, et dans les territoires créés à partir de celui-ci. Les abolitionnistes nous en voudront pour cela, mais c'est un mal nécessaire pour empêcher la fracture de l'Union.

column2: Implemented in 1876, the 'Kanun-i-Easasi' (Basic Law) was an early attempt at gifting the Ottoman Empire with a constitution. While the Basic Law would only remain in effect for two years before being repealed by Sultan Abdulhamid II, it was nevertheless an important forerunner to the later development of Ottoman and Turkish constitutionalism.
column3: Mise en place en 1876, la « Kanun-i-Easasi » (la loi fondamentale) est une première tentative de doter lEmpire ottoman dune constitution. Si la loi fondamentale ne resta en application que deux ans avant dêtre repoussée par le sultan Abdulhamid II, elle constitue cependant un signe précurseur important du futur développement du constitutionnalisme ottoman puis turc.

column2: Karen Horney was a German psychoanalyst. She came to criticize Freud's emphasis on sex and aggressive as motivating drives. Horney (1937) focused on security instead as the central, inborn human need. In her view, child development was contingent upon parental fulfillment of the child's 'basic anxiety' emotion. Success would result in a trusting individual, while failure would result in insecurity. Insecurity and distrust manifests itself in personality as either avoidance, submission or dominance.
column3: Karen Horney was a German psychoanalyst. She came to criticize Freud's emphasis on sex and aggressive as motivating drives. Horney (1937) focused on security instead as the central, inborn human need. In her view, child development was contingent upon parental fulfillment of the child's 'basic anxiety' emotion. Success would result in a trusting individual, while failure would result in insecurity. Insecurity and distrust manifests itself in personality as either avoidance, submission or dominance.

column2: Karl Kautsky joined the Social Democrat Party (SDP) and was responsible for drafting the Erfurt Program which committed the SDP to an evolutionary form of Marxism. He also wrote and published The Economic Doctrines of Karl Marx (1887) and Thomas Moore and His Utopia (1888). After a while he broke with Bernstein, whom he viewed to lenient and instead stayed true to his more revolutionary view of socialism.
column3: Karl Kautsky a rejoint le parti social-démocrate (SDP) et a été chargé de rédiger le programme d'Erfurt qui engagea le SDP comme une forme évolutive du marxisme. Il a également écrit et publié les doctrines économiques de Karl Marx (1887) et Thomas Moore et son Utopie (1888). Après un certain temps, il rompt avec Bernstein, qu'il considérait comme trop clément et, à la place, il est resté fidèle à son point de vue plus révolutionnaire du socialisme.

column2: Knies's linear stages argument spoke of 'moral progress' which would render most theories obsolete. His 1873 work, however, contained little of the historical method in it. His political involvements earned him temporary exile in 1848. He wrote Political Economy from the Standpoint of the Historical Method (1853), and Money and Credit (1873).
column3: L'argument linéaire par étapes de Knies, parle de «progrès moral» qui rendrait la plupart des théories obsolètes. Son travail de 1873, cependant, ne contenait que peu de la méthode historique en lui. Ses engagements politiques lui ont valu l'exil temporaire en 1848. Il a écrit l'économie politique du point de vue de la méthode historique (1853), et de l'argent et de crédit (1873).

column2: Karl Marx was originally disciple of Hegel, but evolved his idealistic philosophy. Later in Paris he began mixing with members of the working class for the first time. Marx was shocked by their poverty but impressed by their sense of comradeship. In an article that he wrote for the Franco-German Annals, Marx applied Hegel's dialectic theory to what he had observed in Paris. Marx, who now described himself as a communist, argued that the working class (the proletariat), would eventually be the emancipators of society. Marx' most influential works were, The German Ideology, The Communist Manifesto, Principles of Communism, and Das Kapital. For most of his life he lived in England where he published his works and from where he became the most influential socialist of all time.
column3: Karl Marx a été à l'origine disciple de Hegel, mais a évolué vers sa philosophie idéaliste. Plus tard, à Paris, il commence à se mélanger pour la première fois, avec les membres de la classe ouvrière. Marx a été choqué par leur pauvreté, mais impressionné par leur sens de la camaraderie. Dans un article qu'il a écrit pour les Annales franco-allemandes, Marx a appliqué la théorie dialectique de Hegel à ce qu'il avait observé à Paris. Marx, qui maintenant se décrit comme un communiste, fait valoir que la classe ouvrière (le prolétariat), serait finalement l'émancipateur de la société. Les travaux les plus influents de Marx ont été : L'Idéologie allemande, Le Manifeste du Parti communiste, Principes du communisme, et Das Kapital. Durant une bonne partie de sa vie, il a vécu en Angleterre où il publia ses uvres et d'où il devînt le socialiste le plus influent de tous les temps.
Monument dédié à un diplomate étranger

column2: The 61 miles long canal is expected to quickly become one of the busiest artificial waterways of the world. The project offers new impetus to commerce and proves that nation's greatness can be achieved through manufacture, trade and engineering rather than through war and conquest.
column3: The 61 miles long canal is expected to quickly become one of the busiest artificial waterways of the world. The project offers new impetus to commerce and proves that nation's greatness can be achieved through manufacture, trade and engineering rather than through war and conquest.

column2: The 61 miles long Kiel Canal is expected to quickly become one of the busiest artificial waterways of the world. The project offers new impetus to commerce for all maritime countries.
column3: The 61 miles long Kiel Canal is expected to quickly become one of the busiest artificial waterways of the world. The project offers new impetus to commerce for all maritime countries.

column2: We are currently processing the receipts for ships having passed through the Kiel canal.
column3: We are currently processing the receipts for ships having passed through the Kiel canal.

column2: Without firing a gun, without drawing a sword, should they make war on us, we could bring the whole world to our feet. What would happen if no cotton was furnished for three years? England would topple headlong and carry the whole civilized world with her to save the South.' -- James Henry Hammond\n\nBy enacting the King Cotton policy, and boycotting all sales of cotton to the European powers, we will give them a reason to intervene on our side in the present conflict between the states.
column3: Sans tirer un coup de feu, sans tirer une épée, si on nous faisait la guerre, nous pourrions mettre le monde entier à nos pieds. [...] Qu'est-ce qui se passerait si nous ne fournissions pas de coton pendant trois ans ? [...] L'Angleterre s'effondrerait la tête la première et entrainerait avec elle tout le monde civilisé, à l'exception du Sud. Non, vous n'oseriez pas faire la guerre au coton. Aucun pouvoir sur terre n'oserait le faire. Le coton est roi ! -- James Henry Hammond -- \n\nEn appliquant la politique du coton-roi, et en boycottant les ventes de coton aux puissances européennes, nous leur donnerons une bonne raison d'intervenir en notre faveur dans le conflit qui divise les Etats.

column2: He was a Swedish economist whose work led to the widespread use of the word 'natural' to explain the long-run equilibrium rate of interest. Wicksell had a tremendous influence on economist James M. Buchanan. According to Buchanan, his theory of public choice 'was an almost natural consequence of my absorption of the Wicksellian message,' which stated that economists must cease acting as if government were a benevolent despot. Wicksell was a Malthusian and a strong advocate of birth control. He spoke out on moral issues quite often. He is best known for his work in 'Interest and Prices', in which he laid out his version of the quantity theory of money. His version was different from the standard view at that time in that he looked at the indirect effect that the money supply has on prices. Wicksell also elaborated on the theory of marginal productivity, which states that the payment to each factor of production equals that factors marginal productivity. He also stated that an efficient allocation of resources does not guarantee equitable distribution, because the preexisting distribution of income determines what form this allocation will take, and the preexisting distribution of income is not always just. The Stockholm School developed its own version of macroeconomics, which was based on Wicksell's work on quantity and price theory.
column3: C'était un économiste suédois dont les travaux ont conduit à l'utilisation répandue du mot «naturel» pour expliquer le taux d'équilibre à long terme d'intérêts. Wicksell a eu une énorme influence sur l'économiste James M. Buchanan. Selon Buchanan, sa théorie de choix public «a été une conséquence presque naturelle de mon absorption du message wicksellien», qui déclare que les économistes doivent cesser d'agir comme si le gouvernement était un despote bienveillant. Wicksell était malthusien et un ardent défenseur de contrôle des naissances. Il s'est prononcé sur les questions morales assez souvent. Il est surtout connu pour son travail dans 'intérêts et prix', dans lequel il exposait sa version de la théorie quantitative de la monnaie. Sa version était différente de la pensée standard du moment qui examinait l'effet indirect de l'offre de monnaie sur les prix. Wicksell a également développé la théorie de la productivité marginale, qui stipule que le paiement de chaque facteur de production est égale à celle de la productivité marginale des facteurs. Il a également déclaré que l'allocation efficiente des ressources ne garantie pas une répartition équitable, parce que la distribution préexistante de revenu détermine la forme que cette allocation aura, et le revenu de distribution préexistante n'est pas toujours juste. L'École de Stockholm avait développé sa propre version de la macro-économie, qui était basée sur les travaux de Wicksell sur la quantité et la théorie des prix.

column2: This was a policy of the Tokugawa shogunate aiming at increasing political coordination between the bakufu and the Imperial Court, as well as appeasing opponents within the shogunate itself.
column3: This was a policy of the Tokugawa shogunate aiming at increasing political coordination between the bakufu and the Imperial Court, as well as appeasing opponents within the shogunate itself.

column2: Advances in aircraft design, improvements to construction, and improved aircraft engines greatly enhanced the abilities of bombers to accomplish thier missions. Increased range, greater payloads, and better armoring all made bombers a much greater threat to combatant nations.

L'augmentation de la portée, une plus grande charge utile, et une meilleure armure, concourent à faire des bombardiers une menace toujours plus grande pour les pays combattants.

column2: In a never ending cycle, advances in one area led directly to advances in other areas. Dedicated fighter aircraft, whose role is to engage enemy aircraft, gained advantages from the same sources as bombers, and in response to advances in bomber aircraft. New engines, better designs, improved sights and improved guns, made these fighters among the deadliest things in the air.
column3: Dans un cycle sans fin, les progrès dans un domaine ont mené directement à des progrès dans d'autres secteurs. Les avions de combat dédiés, dont le rôle est d'engagé les avions ennemis, ont acquis des avantages provenant des avancées des avions bombardiers. Les nouveaux moteurs, des meilleures conceptions, des viseurs améliorés, et des armes plus performantes, ont fait des chasseurs les plus meurtrières des choses en l'air.

column2: Law 1420 of General Common Education was an Argentine law passed in 1884, during president Julio Argentino Roca, that established the country's first free, mandatory, national and secular system of education. While the secular slant of the law caused some friction between the catholic church and the Argentine government, the law can nevertheless be regarded a landmark in the history of Argentine education.
column3: La loi 1420 d'enseignement public fut passée en Argentine en 1884, sous la présidence de Julio Argentino Roca, pour mettre en place le premier système éducatif gratuit, obligatoire et séculaire du pays. Bien que la tendance séculaire de la loi suscita quelques tensions entre l'Église catholique et le gouvernement argentin, cette loi marqua néanmoins un tournant important dans l'histoire de l'Argentine.

column2: In 1870 'The Law of Guarantees' was a law passed by the newly formed Kingdom of Italy -- aimed at solving the 'Roman Question' -- that accorded the pope privileges similar to that of the King himself, including the right to send and receive ambassadors. Pope Pius IX refused to accept the laws, which were seen by both him and his successors as an infringement of the independence of the Holy See. While the issue was not conclusively solved until the Lateran Treaty of 1929, the Law of Guarantees nevertheless meant that the young Kingdom's capital would from then on be Rome.
column3: En 1870, la « Loi des garanties » fut passée par le tout jeune royaume dItalie pour résoudre la « question romaine ». Cette loi accordait au pape des privilèges équivalents à ceux du roi, y compris le droit de recevoir et de nommer des ambassadeurs. Le pape Pie IX refusa la loi, que lui-même et ses successeurs considéraient comme une atteinte à l'indépendance du Saint Siège. Si la question ne fut définitivement réglée quen 1929 avec le Traité de Latran, la loi des garanties a néanmoins établi que la capitale du nouveau royaume serait Rome.

column2: In the United States and overseas territories, the L band is held by the military for telemetry, thereby forcing digital radio to in-band on-channel (IBOC) solutions. column2: Vladimir Ilyich Lenin was a Russian Marxist revolutionary, author, lawyer, economic theorist, political philosopher as well as the creator of the Soviet Communist Party and the leader of the 1917 October Revolution. As a theorist, his extensive theoretical and philisophical contributions to Marxism produced Leninism.

column2: Liberal Rebels strive for the inclusion of broader stratas of the population in the government of the nation. In an absolute monarchy they will rise to impose a constitutional monarchy, whereas they in all other cases seek to establish a democracy.

column2: A "free, sovereign and independent state by the name and style of the Republic of Liberia" was declared by Governor Joseph Jenkins Roberts. Great Britain in particular, operating from neighboring Sierra Leone, regarded the Commonwealth and its parent organization the American Colonization Society (ACS), as "private persons" not entitled to exercise sovereignty. Therefore it was deemed urgent to proceed with formalizing independence. Although endorsed by the US Government, formal diplomatic recognitition by Congress of the new Republic did not come until the Civil War.
column3: A "free, sovereign and independent state by the name and style of the Republic of Liberia" was declared by Governor Joseph Jenkins Roberts. Great Britain in particular, operating from neighboring Sierra Leone, regarded the Commonwealth and its parent organization the American Colonization Society (ACS), as "private persons" not entitled to exercise sovereignty. Therefore it was deemed urgent to proceed with formalizing independence. Although endorsed by the US Government, formal diplomatic recognitition by Congress of the new Republic did not come until the Civil War.

column2: What used to be nothing more than a colony a mere few years back has grown in size and strength enough to aspire to become a free, sovereign and independent state. A draft of the new constitution is ready to be presented for a referendum. It guarantees basic civil rights and establishes the separation of powers similar to the constitution of the United States, while detaching the newly proclaimed state from the United States government and institutions.
column3: What used to be nothing more than a colony a mere few years back has grown in size and strength enough to aspire to become a free, sovereign and independent state. A draft of the new constitution is ready to be presented for a referendum. It guarantees basic civil rights and establishes the separation of powers similar to the constitution of the United States, while detaching the newly proclaimed state from the United States government and institutions.

column2: It has been almost 100 years since France, and General Lafayette, came to the aid of the brave, young American republic at the hour of her birth and most dire need. Since then, the American republic has served as an inspiration to freedom loving people everywhere, and has stood as a clear and voiceful reminder to the world of the possibilities of human liberty. Some within France's republican circles have suggested that we celebrate this centennial by presenting to the American people a suitable gift to mark their first hundred years as a free people, and their historical bonds of friendship with the French nation. Vive la Liberté!
column3: Presque 100 ans se sont écoulés depuis que la France et le général Lafayette, sont venus aider la jeune et brave république américaine alors naissante dans ses heures les plus sombres. Depuis, la république américaine a servi d'inspiration aux peuples révants de liberté, et s'est dressée face au monde avec le souvenir clair et puissant des possibilités de la liberté humaine. Certains membres des cercles républicains français ont proposé de célébrer cet anniversaire en faisant un cadeau approprié au peuple américain, afin d'immortaliser leurs 100 ans d'existence en tant que peuple indépendant, et leurs liens d'amitié avec la France. Vive la liberté !

column2: This is the development of the main side arms of your units. The applications will upgrade the combat values of your divisions. Better applications within this branch will increase the Fire attack value of your units.
column3: Cela concerne l'évolution des principales armes de poing de vos unités. Les améliorations augmenteront la valeur au combat de vos divisions. Des améliorations dans cette branche augmenteront la valeur d'attaque de vos unités.

column2: As experience from the Great War demonstrated, infantry units, especially those operating in rough terrain, needed a viable option for increased fire power. Traditional guns were too heavy, and too bulky to be used effectively or moved rapidly in adverse conditions. Shorter range guns of smaller calibers, which were easily moved by horse, vehicle, or manpower, were developed to fill this need. These are the so called ''mountain guns.''
column3: Comme l'expérience de la Grande Guerre l'a démontré, les unités d'infanterie, en particulier celles opérant en terrain accidenté, avaient besoin d'une option viable pour augmenter leurs puissances de feu. Les canons traditionnels étaient trop lourds et trop volumineux pour être utilisés de manière efficace ou déplacés rapidement en conditions défavorables. Des armes, de courte portée et de petit calibre, qui sont facilement déplaçables par des chevaux, des véhicules, ou de la main-d'oeuvre, ont été développées pour répondre à ce besoin. Ces armes sont appelées 'canons de montagne'.

column2: Light Cruisers are basically Cruisers with additional armaments. They are still not as heavily armoured as battleships and as a result still retain some of the extra speed.
column3: Les croiseurs légers sont fondamentalement des croiseurs dotés de pièces d'armement supplémentaires. Ils ne sont pas aussi lourdement blindés que les cuirassés, ce qui leur permet de se déplacer plus rapidement.

column2: A major step forward in tank technology was the light tank. Generally mounting machine guns or a light gun, these were the first ''true'' tanks to be produced. Used in an infantry-support role, these tanks gave divisions much-needed mobile firepower with a solid defensive capability.
column3: Une avancée majeure dans la technologie du tank a été le char léger. Généralement surmonté de mitrailleuses ou d'un canon léger, ce sont les ''premiers'' vrais chars à être produit. Utilisé dans un rôle de soutien d'infanterie, ces chars apportent beaucoup aux divisions qui ont grand besoin d'une puissance de feu mobile avec une capacité de défense sans failles.

column2: By setting up lighting in the factory building, the efficiency of the production increased. Workers could now work in nightshifts which further increased it.
column3: On a augmenté le rendement de la production en éclairant les usines. Ceci a permis de faire travailler les ouvriers en équipes de nuit.

column2: In order to vote, active registration should be required. This will make our nation's primary and accepted cultures more likely to vote.
column3: Seule la population de la culture principale et de la culture acceptée de votre nation est autorisée à voter.

column2: This was the first legislation enacting the possibilities for ownership in a firm without direct responsibility. This was the first step to ensure infusion of capital from private citizens.
column3: Il s'agissait de la première législation permettant de posséder des parts d'une société sans avoir de responsabilités directes. Cette première étape annonçait le développement de l'introduction de fonds privés dans le capital des entreprises.

column2: The concept of riekisen, or the 'line of advantage', means that we must extend Japanese influence beyond our national borders in order to ensure our security. This means turning all of the Japanese military, and indeed our people, to the notion of foreign conquest and glory.
column3: The concept of riekisen, or the 'line of advantage', means that we must extend Japanese influence beyond our national borders in order to ensure our security. This means turning all of the Japanese military, and indeed our people, to the notion of foreign conquest and glory.

column2: This meant that a bankrupted firm got its assets sold to pay of the moneylenders. This was a complex but important set of laws that was the first step to a stable jurisdiction for bankruptcies.
column3: Désormais, lorsqu'une entreprise faisait faillite, on vendait ses actifs pour rembourser ses créanciers. Cette série de lois complexes mais nécessaires, a constitué la première étape vers une législation sur les faillites.

column2: Liquor is the alcohol available for the broad mass of the populace. Grain is the raw materiel to produce liquor.
column3: Cette distillerie produit l'alcool accessible au grand public. Les céréales constituent la matière première nécessaire à la production de cet alcool.

column2: When literate NCOs started to flock to the ranks the average quality of the units and the training of the soldiers increased.
column3: L'arrivée d'officiers mariniers instruits accrût la qualité des unités et améliora la formation des soldats.

column2: The LLM01 (Laser Light Module 01) is an adaptive target acquisition module made by Oerlikon Contraves GmbH in Stockach, Germany. It is designed to be mounted with a metal integral quick release clamping adapter on the left side of the carry handle adapter of Heckler & Koch G36 assault rifles. It can also be attached to other firearms, such as the Heckler & Koch MP7 submachine gun and L85A2 assault rifle.

It is designed to be mounted with a metal integral quick release clamping adapter on the left side of the carry handle adapter of Heckler & Koch G36 assault rifles. It can also be attached to other firearms, such as the Heckler & Koch MP7 submachine gun and L85A2 assault rifle.

column2: In a highly militarized society, or a normal society in war, often not only military-civilian cooperation boards on a local level were needed, but sometimes most of the local government could be appointed officers as well. This meant not only a strong military control, but also that the power of the Navy increased disproportionally in comparison to other governmental agencies.
column3: Dans une société fortement militarisée, ou une société normale en guerre, il est souvent nécessaire, non seulement d'avoir la coopération civilo-militaire au niveau local, mais parfois d'avoir dans l'administration locale des officiers en poste. Cela signifie non seulement un fort contrôle militaire, mais aussi que la puissance de la Marine peut augmenter de manière disproportionnée par rapport à d'autres agences gouvernementales.

column2: A local Stock Exchange operates in this province, increasing local production output.
column3: Cette province abrite une bourse locale qui améliore la production locale.

column2: Logging is the process of systematically harvesting a country's timber resources, replacing traditional methods of lumberjacking that relied primarily on disorganized groups of laborers cutting down what trees they could find and selling the timber on the market in a manner similar to farmers.
column3: Logging is the process of systematically harvesting a country's timber resources, replacing traditional methods of lumberjacking that relied primarily on disorganized groups of laborers cutting down what trees they could find and selling the timber on the market in a manner similar to farmers.

column2: Logical positivists denied the soundness of metaphysics and traditional philosophy. They asserted that many philosophical problems are indeed meaningless, primarily concerned with the logical analysis of scientific knowledge. They though failed to secure what they themselves considered to be the sound foundation of knowledge and is today most often considered a dead-end.
column3: Les positivistes logiques nient le bien-fondé de la métaphysique et de la philosophie traditionnelle. Ils ont affirmé que de nombreux problèmes philosophiques sont dénués de sens, principalement par l'analyse logique de la connaissance scientifique. Ils ont échoué à obtenir ce qu'ils envisageaient comme un solide fondement de connaissances et c'est aujourd'hui le plus souvent considéré comme une impasse.

column2: These standard measurements of how much supplies and reinforcements a standard unit needed during a defined time period made it easier to plan for a war.
column3: Ces mesures standard, sur les quantités de ravitaillement et de renforts nécessaires à une unité type pour une période donnée, permettaient de préparer plus facilement les guerres.

column2: This tactic meant lying out of the firing range of the enemy's guns and hitting them with longer ranging guns, or by quickly moving in to get off the guns and then quickly move out to be out of enemy range.
column3: Cette tactique consistait à rester hors de portée des tirs de canons ennemis et à le frapper avec des canons de plus longue portée ou à ne s'en approcher que le temps d'une salve.

column3: We have lost control over the colony.

column2: Louis Pasteur was a French chemist and microbioligist who is remembered for his remarkable breakthroughs in the causes and preventions of diseases. His discoveries reduced mortality from puerperal fever, and he created the first vaccine for rabies and anthrax. He was best known to the public for inventing a method to stop milk and wine from causing sickness, a process that came to be called pasteurization.
column3: Louis Pasteur was a French chemist and microbioligist who is remembered for his remarkable breakthroughs in the causes and preventions of diseases. His discoveries reduced mortality from puerperal fever, and he created the first vaccine for rabies and anthrax. He was best known to the public for inventing a method to stop milk and wine from causing sickness, a process that came to be called pasteurization.

column2: By introducing divisional artillery and mortars down on battalion level, units got better firepower much faster. This was in turn very important both in offense and defense.

column3: Air emissions and toxic waste dumping are regulated.

column2: The Berkeley Lower Extremity Exoskeleton (BLEEX) is a robotic device that attaches to the lower body. Its purpose is to complement the user's strength by adding extra force to one's lower extremity bodily movements.
column3: The Berkeley Lower Extremity Exoskeleton (BLEEX) is a robotic device that attaches to the lower body. Its purpose is to complement the user's strength by adding extra force to one's lower extremity bodily movements.

column2: The people in this province are generally supportive of our rule, and several of them serve, or are willing to serve, in colonial military regiments
column3: Généralement, les habitants de cette province vous soutiennent. D'ailleurs, certains servent ou sont prêts à servir dans les régiments militaires coloniaux.

column2: An Austrian economist who would challenge the growing influence of Keynesian economics upon the actions of the State in the 1930s. Von Mises argued that the attempt by the State to use its resources to revive demand in the economy created dangerous potentials for inflation of the economy and severe imbalances in the ability of the marketplace to find the balance between supply and demand that would ensure stable economic growth. Von Mises was also a sharp critic of socialist economic models, arguing that such models removed the ability of the market to determine price levels that would ensure adequate supply based on the demands of consumers for goods
column3: Un économiste autrichien qui remettait en cause l'influence croissante de l'économie keynésienne sur les actions de l'Etat dans les années 1930. Von Mises a fait valoir que la tentative par l'État d'utiliser ses ressources pour relancer la demande dans l'économie a créé du danger potentiel par l'inflation de l'économie et de graves déséquilibres dans la capacité du marché à trouver l'équilibre entre l'offre et la demande, permettant d'assurer une croissance économique stable. Von Mises a également été un critique acerbe des  modèles économiques socialistes, faisant valoir que de tels modèles retiraient de la capacité au marché pour la détermination des niveaux de prix assurant un approvisionnement adéquat en fonction des demandes des consommateurs pour ces produits.

column2: In a lumber mill, timber is processed into lumber. Lumber can then be used for buildings, paper, ships or furniture.
column3: La scierie transforme la matière première en bois débité. Ce bois sert à construire des bâtiments, des navires, des meubles ou à fabriquer du papier.

column2: In a lumber mill, timber is processed into lumber. Lumber can then be used for buildings, paper, ships or furniture.

column2: Small lumbering operations have grown into an industry capable of building giant mills, all to feed our growing need for construction material.
column3: Small lumbering operations have grown into an industry capable of building giant mills, all to feed our growing need for construction material.

column2: The production of finery has moved from the work of individual artisans to factories where such clothing can be produced en masse.
column3: The production of finery has moved from the work of individual artisans to factories where such clothing can be produced en masse.

column2: In this factory, regular clothes are reworked using silk to produce luxury clothes for the rich stratas of the populace.
column3: Dans cette usine, les vêtements ordinaires sont retraités avec de la soie afin de produire des vêtements de soie pour les classes supérieures de la population.

column3: Our nation's industry has become slowly turned towards the production of luxury goods such as boots, wine, cigars and luxury clothing and furniture.

column2: Here, furniture is transformed into a luxury good using tropical wood. The resulting luxury furniture is used by the rich stratas of the population for their homes.
column3: Les meubles sont ici transformés en produits de luxe grâce à du bois exotique. Le mobilier de luxe qui en résulte est acheté par les classes supérieures de la population.

column2: The French economist Léon Walras (pronounced 'Valrasse') has been hailed by Joseph Schumpeter as 'the greatest of all economists'. Walras was one of the three leaders of the Marginalist Revolution, even though his greatest work, Elements of Pure Economics, was published in 1874, three years after those of William Stanley Jevons and Carl Menger. Nonetheless, alone among the three revolutionaries, Léon Walras set forth the new 'marginalist' or 'Neoclassical' theory in a formal general equilibrium setting.   Thus, he endowed it with the multi-market considerations Jevons had largely avoided and the mathematical precision Menger had eschewed. Léon Walras is widely and rightfully regarded as the father of general equilibrium theory.
column3: L'économiste français Léon Walras (prononcé Valrasse) a été salué par Joseph Schumpeter comme «le plus grand de tous les économistes». Walras a été l'un des trois leaders de la révolution marginaliste, même si sa plus grande uvre, Eléments de pure économie, a été publié en 1874, trois ans après ceux de William Stanley Jevons et de Carl Menger. Néanmoins, seul des trois révolutionnaires, Léon Walras énonce les nouveaux 'marginaliste' ou 'néo-classique' une théorie dans un cadre d'équilibre général formel. Ainsi, il l'a doté avec les considérations multi-marché que Jevons avait largement évité et de la précision mathématique que Menger avait évité. Léon Walras est partout et à juste titre considéré comme le père de la théorie de l'équilibre général.

column2: A major component of the modernization process, a new military signal called M-code was designed to further improve the anti-jamming and secure access of the military GPS signals. The M-code is transmitted in the same L1 and L2 frequencies already in use by the previous military code, the P(Y) code. The new signal is shaped to place most of its energy at the edges (away from the existing P(Y) and C/A carriers).
column3: A major component of the modernization process, a new military signal called M-code was designed to further improve the anti-jamming and secure access of the military GPS signals. The M-code is transmitted in the same L1 and L2 frequencies already in use by the previous military code, the P(Y) code. The new signal is shaped to place most of its energy at the edges (away from the existing P(Y) and C/A carriers).

column2: The Gatling gun, patented in 1861 by Richard Jordan Gatling, was the first to offer controlled, sequential fire with automatic loading. It first saw very limited action in the American Civil War
column3: it was subsequently improved and used in the Franco-Prussian war and North-West Rebellion. Many were sold to other armies in the late 19th century and continued to be used into the early 20th century. The first self-powered machine gun was invented in 1885 by Sir Hiram Maxim. The ""Maxim gun"" used the recoil power of the previously fired bullet to reload rather than being hand-powered, enabling a much higher rate of fire than was possible using earlier designs such as the Nordenfelt and Gatling weapons."

column2: Machine guns have been successfully deployed throughout our armed forces, upgrading their existing firepower significantly.
column3: Machine guns have been successfully deployed throughout our armed forces, upgrading their existing firepower significantly.

column2: Machine parts are very important tools for every industrial plant. Steel and Coal are required to produce them.
column3: Les pièces mécaniques sont indispensables à toutes les usines. De l'acier et du charbon sont nécessaires pour les produire.

column2: By constructing special machines that produced standardized machine tools the exchangeability in industry was vastly improved.
column3: En construisant des machines spéciales qui produisent elles-mêmes des machines-outils standardisées, l'interchangeabilité dans l'industrie a été grandement améliorée.

column2: All adult males must serve in the military.
column3: All adult males must serve in the military.

column2: To bring civilization from coast to shining coast has always been the grand mission of our great republic. Let the Eagle spread it's wings.
column3: La doctrine de la «destinée manifeste» est apparue en premier aux États-Unis dans les années 1840 pour justifier la nécessité de s'étendre vers l'ouest. Déjà en 1823, la doctrine de Monroe avait interdit à la colonisation européenne en Amérique. Les États-Unis avaient une obligation nouvelle pour étendre ses frontières continentales et développer sa civilisation sur tout le continent. L'idée de base était que la nation était destinée à la grandeur et à l'expansion.

column2: The Manifesto on Unshakable Autocracy' was published by Tsar Alexander III on the 29 of April 1881 (Julian Calendar), approximately two months after his father, Alexander II, was assassinated by Nikolai Rysakov of the Narodnaya Volya terrorist organization. The manifesto strongly rejected any ideas of liberal reform, many of them his father's own, instead arguing in favor of the traditional, unshakable, autocracy of Russia.
column3: Le Manifeste du 29 avril 1881 (11 mai 1881 dans le calendrier grégorien), dit aussi le Manifeste d'Alexandre, fut publié par le tsar Alexandre III environ deux mois après l'assassinat de son père, Alexandre II, par Nikolai Rysakov de l'organisation terroriste Narodnaya Volya. Le manifeste rejetait vivement toutes les idées de réforme libérale, idées pour la plupart partagées par son père, préférant plaider en faveur de la traditionnelle et inébranlable autocratie de Russie.

column2: Marcel Mauss was a French sociologst. Mauss' academic work traversed the boundaries between sociology and anthropology. Today, he is perhaps better recognised for his influence on the latter discipline, particularly with respect to his analyses of topics such as magic, sacrifice and gift exchange in primitive cultures.
column3: Marcel Mauss was a French sociologst. Mauss' academic work traversed the boundaries between sociology and anthropology. Today, he is perhaps better recognised for his influence on the latter discipline, particularly with respect to his analyses of topics such as magic, sacrifice and gift exchange in primitive cultures.

column2: By instituting a separate agency for monitoring the behaviour of actors on the market the government had a chance to stop firms from crashing and also to restrain them from committing fraud.
column3: Le gouvernement a créé un organisme indépendant pour contrôler le comportement des acteurs de la bourse et éviter ainsi, autant que possible, les faillites et les fraudes des sociétés.

column2: This style of business culture meant that the owners were either foundations or household investors. This often meant a conservative but sound regime.
column3: Avec ce style de culture d'entreprise, les actionnaires étaient en partie des gros investisseurs fortement impliqués, et en partie des petits investisseurs privés. Ce système était souvent conservateur mais plutôt sain.

column3: Cette méthode purifiait non seulement le fer lors du processus de transformation en acier mais permettait aussi d'utiliser du fer jusque-là jugé de qualité insuffisante.

column2: Mary Calkins was an American teacher who became the first female President of the American Psychological Association. A student of James' in 1890, Calkins completed the requirements for a PhD at Harvard only to be refused. She went on to a distinguished tenure at Wellesley College, writing about the psychology of the self: 'a totality, a one of many characters... a unique being in the sense that I am I and you are you'....
column3: Mary Calkins was an American teacher who became the first female President of the American Psychological Association. A student of James' in 1890, Calkins completed the requirements for a PhD at Harvard only to be refused. She went on to a distinguished tenure at Wellesley College, writing about the psychology of the self: 'a totality, a one of many characters... a unique being in the sense that I am I and you are you'....

column2: The rapid spread of basic functional literacy in industrial societies combined with the improvements in communication technologies to lay the basis for the development of new approaches to the promotion of creating demand for the rapidly increasing output of goods by increasingly efficient industrial systems. Drawing upon increased understanding of the nature of human compulsions shaped by the environment around them, advertisers would also learn lessons gained by States in their propaganda efforts during periods of war to rally the population to support the goals of the nation in its conflict. The result would be a rapid expansion of the use of simple, direct means of advertising to popularize new products and increase the appeal and demand for established products would become permanent features of popular culture as the twentieth century evolved, and would eventually come to impact other realms of public life, including politics
column3: L'avancée rapide dans les sociétés industrielles de l'alphabétisation des peuples et les avancées dans les techniques de communication servirent de base au développement de nouvelles approches commerciales, permettant de créer de la demande pour des biens de consommation dont la production ne cessa d'augmenter, résultante de l'efficacité grandissante des systèmes industriels. S'appuyant sur la compréhension nouvelle de la nature des compulsions humaines, directement liées à son environnement, les annonceurs acquirent également les techniques des États dans leurs efforts de propagande durant les périodes de guerre, quand ils rallièrent les populations pour soutenir la nation dans son conflit. Il en découla une rapide expansion de l'utilisation de publicités simples et directes destinées à populariser les nouveaux produits, et à augmenter l'attrait et la demande des produits. Ce système s'encra de manière permanente à la culture populaire au cours du 20ième siècles, et finit par s'incruster dans d'autres domaines de la vie publique, ainsi qu'en politique.

column2: Advancement in techniques for creating clothing have increased our capacity for its production. No longer is it limited to the shops of the simple tailor.
column3: Advancement in techniques for creating clothing have increased our capacity for its production. No longer is it limited to the shops of the simple tailor.

column3: En combinant les apports du Fordisme et des techniques métallurgiques, on a pu produire des rails en série. Dès lors, on a pu étendre à moindre coût le réseau ferroviaire.

column2: Karl Emil Maximilian Weber was a German sociologist and political economist who profoundly influenced social theory, social research, and the discipline of sociology itself. Weber's major works dealt with the rationalization and 'disenchantment' he associated with the rise of capitalism and modernity.
column3: Karl Emil Maximilian Weber was a German sociologist and political economist who profoundly influenced social theory, social research, and the discipline of sociology itself. column2: This was a power-driven saw that vastly increased the rate of cut down timber.
column3: C'est une scie automatique qui permettait d'accroître considérablement la vitesse de coupe du bois.

column2: The introduction of mechanization to plantations allowed for harvesting to occur more rapidly, and for far more land to be manageable by the individual farmer. This freed up a great deal of labor, and led to the growth of urban centers.
column3: The introduction of mechanization to plantations allowed for harvesting to occur more rapidly, and for far more land to be manageable by the individual farmer. This freed up a great deal of labor, and led to the growth of urban centers.

column2: This area involves the development of mechanizations in the factories of your country. It concerns both machinery, tools and working procedures.
column3: Ce domaine concerne le développement de la mécanisation des usines de votre pays. Il implique à la fois la machinerie, les outils et les procédures de travail.

column2: Traditional methods of harvest are slowly being discarded as new, mechanical inventions are being produced. These will greatly speed up a farm's harvest, and allow the individual farm to cover much greater area than ever before.
column3: Traditional methods of harvest are slowly being discarded as new, mechanical inventions are being produced. These will greatly speed up a farm's harvest, and allow the individual farm to cover much greater area than ever before.

column2: At this point specialized ships were made, which could not only forest the sea with mechanized fishing nets, but also sort, clean and pack the fish onboard. That this increased the output was evident.

column2: By mechanizing the procedure inside the slaughterhouse the handling was sped up and output increased.
column3: On améliora le rendement et la production des abattoirs en mécanisant la procédure.

column2: The ability to pump oil from the ground through automated machinery has greatly increased the capacity of the individual well. Already production has begun to skyrocket.
column3: The ability to pump oil from the ground through automated machinery has greatly increased the capacity of the individual well. Already production has begun to skyrocket.

column2: While Belgium's de facto independence from The Netherlands had been established by force of arms during the Belgian revolution of 1831, it has not been confirmed de jure by The Netherlands and technically a state of war still exists between the two nations. The idea has arisen that the British Empire should step in and mediate a settlement, demanding the Dutch give up their claims in return for guarantees of Belgian independence and control over Luxembourg. With the powers of Europe at the table, it seems unlikely the Dutch would refuse.
column3: While Belgium's de facto independence from The Netherlands had been established by force of arms during the Belgian revolution of 1831, it has not been confirmed de jure by The Netherlands and technically a state of war still exists between the two nations. The idea has arisen that the British Empire should step in and mediate a settlement, demanding the Dutch give up their claims in return for guarantees of Belgian independence and control over Luxembourg. With the powers of Europe at the table, it seems unlikely the Dutch would refuse.

column2: Coming out of the mold of traditional artillery, combined with the experiences of the Great War and the rapid increase in motorisation, the medium artillery gun was developed. Of modest calibers, these guns were the standard for regular infantry units, providing them with a greater fire power capability and mobility that they had previously lacked.
column3: Au sortir du moule traditionnel de l'artillerie, combiné avec les expériences de la Grande Guerre et l'augmentation rapide de la motorisation, le canon d'artillerie moyenne a été développé. De calibres modestes, ces armes ont été la norme pour les unités d'infanterie, en leur fournissant une capacité en puissance de feu accrue et la mobilité dont elles manquaient jusqu'alors.

column2: MEADS is to provide capabilities beyond any other fielded or planned air and missile defense system. It is to be easily deployed to a theater of operations and once there, will keep pace with fast-moving maneuver forces. When completed, MEADS will be the only air and missile defense system able to roll off tactical transports with the troops and almost immediately begin operations. More importantly, its open architecture will provide for 21st century air and missile defense system-of-system integration capabilities that allow operational mission-tailoring for homeland defense or defense of maneuver forces. MEADS will also provide greater firepower with less manpower than current systems, producing dramatic operation and support cost savings.
column3: MEADS is to provide capabilities beyond any other fielded or planned air and missile defense system. It is to be easily deployed to a theater of operations and once there, will keep pace with fast-moving maneuver forces. When completed, MEADS will be the only air and missile defense system able to roll off tactical transports with the troops and almost immediately begin operations. More importantly, its open architecture will provide for 21st century air and missile defense system-of-system integration capabilities that allow operational mission-tailoring for homeland defense or defense of maneuver forces. MEADS will also provide greater firepower with less manpower than current systems, producing dramatic operation and support cost savings.
